Now I love this app but most of the time you need to be connected to wi-fi and I understand that and why make people use real money just to get to adds and also they use "oh get premium to get no adds and unlimited skips" like some people don't have the money to purchase it and some might be children okay 😑

The functionality of this app has been all over the place lately. Having a lot of pausing lately whenever there's minor connection hiccups. C'mon. Yes I have tried rebooting device and logging in and out. I've tried setting up offline playing. It keeps stopping. Fix your junk.

Spotify has a decent interface, and it's pretty easy to discover new music. Easy to organize playlists and the audio book feature is a good bonus. However, it's terrible at playing any local files you have on your phone/pc. I have to use a different app to listen to songs that aren't on Spotify, and I have a lot of those. Because of this, I would probably cancel my premium subscription. But since I get it at a discount, I'll keep it for now.

An 'okay' music streaming app. This app has gone down in performance since 07/14/2014, which is when I first started using this product. I had initially rated it 5 stars. It accompanied me through train rides, airplane flights, & road trips faithfully. Since 2020, I have become less and less happy. My 2025 wrapped was the most inaccurate of them all. There are also rumors that they don't fairly compensate artists. Also: even PAID memberships limit audiobook listening hours.. very disappointed

this app doesn't just have the music you're looking for it also shows you new music it thinks you would enjoy,so far it's been a great mood saver and gives you a broader perspective of culture music you would have never guessed that you would like. better than any other music app I've had before.!!

When searching for a song, clicking the song starts playing a different song as though maybe a playlist was selected. Adding songs to a list does not work. The app always starts playing through Android auto when I get in my car even though I was listening to FM the last time I turned off the car.

Dear developers, This app sucks. Most of the time it's fine, but now it's just hating on me, and gives me 2-3 ads after every 1 or 2 songs, which is terrible, and also when playing my liked songs playlist, it plays about 1 song and switches to random songs that I have no idea what they are, and used every single one of my 6 skips, and every one of the songs was completely unknown to me. I even turned it off in my settings, and I would like for you to fix it. Thank you.

I love the app and love to listen to music but recently ever since I got a new update when I go into liked songs and click a genre it will shuffle though all songs not just the genre songs which bums me out because I will be listening to rock and now instead of more rock I get a slow song or pop song and I will have to go back to playlist which I don't like because I bounce around on songs a lot.

I hate that the ads are so loud. I am trying to adjust the volume, and it is so complicated. I can't find the volume controls anywhere. And just an FYI, having ads so loud that they sound like I am being yelled at and making me stressed is NOT beneficial for the company paying for the ads. All that does is make me adjust the volume on my phone all the way to zero until the ad is finished.

It's very dependable when you have premium, however the ads can become slightly annoying if you don't have premium. I mean five ads in a row is a bit excessive, furthermore some of the features with the free plan like not being able to pick a specific song to listen to are also very agitating, besides that Spotify is pretty good.

I normally have nothing but positive things to say about Spotify but this week for some reason there is a bug that won't allow me to open the app. I'm patiently waiting for an update to fix it so I can listen to my books and music that I pay for again at work. Normally 5 stars but right now as it's unusable 3 stars.

Spotify is so glitchy I pay for a premium listening experience and it's been anything but, the smart shuffle does not work it plays the same songs over and over again same for the dj what's the point in having a randomly generated playlists if it's the same songs on repeat also the qeue features doesn't work if I add a song to it they disappear and never play fix your app and maybe I'll consider resubscribing but until then I'll take my business to apple music and SoundCloud

Great music source with a full variety to choose from. I had to lower from 5 stats to 3 because they added a lot more advertising. and the ads start right in the middle of a song. pretty aggravating when they could run the ad right after the song finishes🤬

The free plan is a masive load of bull. First of all i get like 10 adds for only 3 songs, my 1000+ song playlist only plays about 30 songs, i have to listen on shuffle, and yalls "30 mins of add free music" is a complete lie because ill get one of those adds and then right after only listen to one song and then another 10 adds pop up, you guys are making spotify free almost unusable

This app is no longer usable to listen to music with unless you have premium. you can't even see what is going to play next in your queue, you don't even get close to 30min of listening before getting a dozen god dang ads. I will be switching over all my Playlists to a new platform or offline folder. spotify can go suck a fat one, premium is not worth 12 bucks a month.

Each and every artist I've ever looked for is available on here, the audio quality is great, it's so simple to use. The free service is absolutely horrendous, makes the premium service a game changer. Strategies I guess. Now personally, having to login on my PC to rearrange playlists is one of the most annoying things about Spotify, revive the ability to do that on mobile. Another annoying thing is how some song lyrics don't sync with the song or don't exist at all.

I like the variety, and that there are podcasts AND audiobooks! However, the phone app makes it hard to enjoy Spotify without getting premium, which is pricey for just one person. There is a 6 skip limit per hour, and I cannot choose what song I want to play when. I cannot unshuffle, nor can I 'add song to Queue.' It's very frustrating, especially if you want to play songs in a certain order, like if you are streaming Hamilton. It would be nice if I could listen to Hamilton in order.

The app works great, but has some major issues as well. One, the free version often claims you get 30 minutes of ad free listening, but it's a blatant lie. It's never worked once for me. I've followed all trouble shooting steps and contacted support, still doesn't work. And the ads are garbage. Constantly seeing the same handful of ads, sometimes the exact same ad will play twice in the same ad break. Also many of the ads are WAY too loud. Cannot wait to find a decent alternative to Spotify.

I've had a fairly rocky journey when it comes to music apps, but after I landed on Spotify, I never looked back. I listen when I'm gaming, drawing, reading, Stretching, etc. The problem with ads feels non-existent, honestly. I hardly get ads enough for me to be annoyed. Spotify has just been super nice! Chromebook especially. I move around often, so being able to listen to music even when my Chromebook is kept safe in my bag is neat. Anyway, I just really like the app, give it a shot!

Spotify was great until they decided to update their app. I can no longer remove songs from my queue. This is probably not a big deal to most people, and some people might say to just skip the song(s), but that gets annoying. I play random playlists and my own playlists, which sometimes have multiple songs that I either do not like, or would not like to to listen to, and this feature helped with that. Now, I can no longer do that. Please bring the feature back, that's all I'm asking for.

It's great overall for organization. It's got a decent selection of songs, and I do like how easy it is to organize playlists. It deserves a higher rating because i do love spotify, but why I gave it 2 is because of the recent lack of care for all of us. Especially with 2024 wrapped. They've been using AI to cut corners and make-up statistics. It's lazy. The amount of ads are also crazy. I only have 30min of music I can listen to at work, and 13 are ads. I miss old spotify.

The only con is, you can't put the podcasts(episodes) on repeat, which really bums me out, because some songs aren't on Spotify and are on as episodes instead because the artist decided not to upload them. You also can't add a song more than once to a playlist anymore. You used to be able to, but I don't know what happened. These are the only two (personally) problems! Otherwise, I would recommend!

As of 02/14/25, the widget functionality is fixed. Thank you for repairing the issue. I enjoy this app overall. I wish we had the capability to customize our app and profiles with colors, pictures, etc. It should be considered a premium feature as expensive as the subscription is. We should also have the capability to see an open mini window of the full version of the app in the widgets and notification bar, please. Thank you.

I love Spotify for music, podcast and audiobooks! Been a customer for over a decade......the only issue I have is that on podcast episodes that are locked due to it being a premium eposide you can't hide the eposide or mark it as listed to clear it from your eposides so you just have a ton of ones on your queue you can't listen to or clear.

There used to be a way to get a 30-minute break from ads each hour, but even if the app gives me that, an ad will come on three minutes later. The reels that say "Similar to" have an end to them when you used to be able to scroll and listen endlessly. And while the ads were annoying, I used to be able to pause the ad, close the app, and open the app again and the ad would be gone. The new update took that feature away. It's still a good app, but it gets 4 stars due to these recent issues.

App was perfect up until recently. The picture-in-picture mode broke completely on my Spotify. For example, if I'm watching a podcast, it'll take up half the entire screen and won't go any smaller than the usual max size. I've reset my phone over it. Didn't work. I can't watch any video/podcast on Spotify without the video taking over most of my screen. If uninstalling and reinstalling don't work, I'm probably switching to a different app until the issue is resolved. Edit: it didn't work.

Lately, every time I turn on music on Spotify, and I leave the app to go on another app, like Pintrest, shopping sites, and others, my music would turn off and I'll have to go all the way back to Spotify to turn on my music and have to restart the song all the way from the top, which is VERY annoying to me. Also, the ads that says the enjoy your 30 minutes of music, doesn't actually give me 30 free minutes of no ads, which is VERY annoying as well. It needs to get fixed.

This is a great app. I love that I can create playlists and download whole albums. The variety is absolutely amazing. The reason I didn't give 5 stars is an ad thing. I watch the ad and it says "Enjoy 30 minutes of uninterrupted music." Two song out and a blare of ads. This is how I put my little ones to sleep and the ads wake them up. Hopefully it's only a glitch and that can be addressed. I'm fairly new to this.

I already bought spotify for a year and they STILL keep pushing for me to upgrade to a more expensive option. Can I listen to music in peace??😂 Their shuffle feature ( in all areas) is just not good. Also it's a really tough app to help you discover new music. You have to really dig deep. I'm not a fan of their Spotfiy Wrapped anymore either, it's quality and accuracy decreased, which defeats the purpose. There is room for improvement for sure

This music app is alright, but it isn't the same anymore. I remember my first time having this app. Spotify Premium was just an optional choice, I was able to listen to any song that I like, and I could turn shuffle and loop on and off when I wanted to. But now we're required to have premium. Now I can't listen to any song when I want to without having ads appearing anytime and the shuffle button stays on. I can't even loop songs or playlists anymore. Please bring back the old Spotify I know.

It's amazing, yeah, sure. Yet, for Spotify free, it says you have '6 free skips her hour'. Yeah, more like 2-4 skips over hour. And, on PC, that isn't a problem.. Just mobile. Isn't a problem on console either. And, to add one more thing, that personally annoys me, you can't even start your free trial for Spotify premium without paying for a subscription after. Why can't I see what's it's like and then decide if I want to buy it after I try it?

I love how Spotify has everything in one place. From music to podcasts to audiobooks, whatever want to listen to, I can almost always find it there. However, I cannot give it 5 stars as there is ALWAYS room for improvement. One thing I think they should change is instead of so many free hours of audiobook listening a month, you should get so many titles. After these last 2 price hikes, I will not pay for top up hours. What am I getting for the added cost? Otherwise, I love it.

Sometimes, my stream of advertisements is interrupted by music. The selection of music is huge, but the free version is barely usable. When they tell you "30 minutes uninterrupted," it's a blatant lie. You are constantly bombarded with ads. It feels like half of the sound coming out of the app is trying to sell you something. Playlists are only available on shuffle, and any album with a sense of continuity is ruined by the random jumble and constant bombardment. It gets a light 2 stars.

I love Spotify, though I have premium and would not be able to go back to ads. It is definitely worth it to choose which songs I want to play, queue up music, and have jams. I would like to see a feature to hide artists I follow under "your library," just to clean it up. I never look at there music there, it just makes me scroll further to playlists after I follow them.

Theres gotta be a way for downloads to last longer than 30 days, my job requires for me to go out to sea, sometimes I don't touch land for more than 30 days and im left with just silence and a useless app. Its bums me out but everything else works and provides. Wish there was a way to shout out smaller artists to discover hidden gems. Music recommendations are always about what's popular and not to music similar to what you listen to.

Spotify has been my go-to music app for a decade now, and premium has always been worth it. Now, my app crashes regularly when using any kind of Bluetooth connection, and my liked songs will only fully load 1/3 of the time, the rest of the time it loads about the 50 most recent songs I've liked. I've cleared my cache and reinstalled, I'm sure this can't be a problem only I have had. Why am I paying for a premium experience when I can't even listen to my music half the time??

For the most part, this is one of the best apps I've used for music, I will say, once you give into premium you probably won't go back, I wish ads gave you like an hour of free listening instead of 30 minutes, as they give you maybe 3-6 ads in a row. Otherwise, this is a great app until I purchase all my music, and It makes it much easier to find songs as it goes by not only taste but also by the year of music you're listening to, which has helped me find many good songs several times over.

It was tough, between a 2 or three star. Been having problems with the app. Great love it, Listening to music. But constant problems, stops playing on phone and console. After a few song and one ad, then keeps signing me out of app for no reason, or just stops working all together. Even after uninstalling and reinstalling. Still the same issues, across every device. Even after changing pass and signing out everywhere. Same thing over and over again.

The only thing this app is good for is playing songs. Viewing the lyrics are limited unless you pay for a supstiption, and if you don't play Spotify on your TV, you can't click the song you want to listen too because it automatically plays a completely different song. For example, say you want to listen to (song one) by your favorite artist. You click on the song and press play, and it automatically plays (song two). It extremely frustrating, I've seen better from a YouTube playlist. 😒

Spotify is a wonderful app for finding the music you know. Beyond that, it's interface, recommendations and features are useless. Want to find new music similar to what you're listening to now? Too bad, because Spotify's recommendations only show you things you played two years ago and no longer like. To be fair, I have found plenty of good, new music on Spotify, but only after spending hours looking through albums and artists, only to find a few songs at a time.

The app forces "smart shuffle" one when you attempt to turn shuffle on/off and there is nothing "smart" about it. The app also forces terrible music and podcast suggestions to your home screen that have absolutely nothing to do with your current music or listening interest. The app does have a very large amount of different and obscure music that's always a plus.

Spotify is great, i love to listen to music on here. but sometimes the app just turns off, for example, i can be playin a game with spotify playin in the background and it might turn off and i have to leave the game and reopen spotify to turn the song back on. And the ai dj, it works great, im using it right now. But it skips the first parts of songs, i dont know if that is how it supposted to work or what, but it would be nice to have the option to change it to play the full song.

Could you guys fix the issue with DJ that happens when you switch what devices you're listening from. It causes your track name and / or time to be wrong and usually includes the unreliability of controls. Like you straight up can't control your music, and it can usually only be fixed by with a force stop of the application. Sometimes, you can skip the song, and it'll fix itself, but not usually, and that sucks having to deal with, especially when you want to save a song. PC, Samsung GS22 thx:)

Spotify got noticeably better in the past few months, it used to be unusable without premium. But it's better now, with MOBILE playlist sorting, so now you can organize your songs without a laptop or computer, which is amazing. But one thing that really pains me is the blatant lying from the ads. I kid you not they play an ad saying "Enjoy the next 30 minutes of ad free listening" and ONE song later they play THREE CONSECUTIVE ads in a row.

Barely worth it. I get my music, all the music without adds, my bare minimum experience, for just a little too much money. So that when they do something minorly annoying, like recommending songs I didn't ask for or popups, I get unreasonably angry. I am in a constant state of "give me a reason to cancel" but I don't so I guess they have me right where they want me. On second thought, don't get stuck here like me, run while you can!

Used to be great, now is awful. I switched to Spotify from Amazon Music around 2022. I was impressed at first; the algorithms were great, the radio stations were great, I was discovering new music I liked. It was awesome. After the 1st year (not coincidentally around when they cut all their staff) the algorithm got wack. When I shuffle my liked songs it makes me listen to the same 10 day after day. When I click a song radio, the playlist is so wack I can't imagine putting those songs together.

ugh, so annoyed with the latest update and the changes to the Queue feature. overall, the design is fine and a bit more modern. but functionally, it took a step back. you can no longer remove songs/episodes from the Queue! this is super annoying. I used this feature multiple times per day, and no longer having that option is beyond inconvenient.

I had MP3 before Spotify. I was so frustrated with the dominating commercials that would take over your phone. To the point I missed important phone calls and notification. Spotify has a more intuitive user interface that suits my needs. Thank you for letting me be able to turn on the music I need to keep me at a good pace and focus. While I work in the laboratory . To design and troubleshoot electronics / electrical controls.

This app has been malfunctioning for so long. Over 2 years and several devices, the same issues have yet to be fixed. This app freezes and crashes so often, I'm starting to think the bugs are what I'm paying for. It's shocking that after so many updates, none of the issues are fixed, only new features are added which give the app more information to process so it can crash even more. It's meant to listen to music, let it be that, and fix the issues that stop people from doing that. Disappointing

Spotify has seriously gotten so much worse. Unusable. I remember using the free version back in like 2017/18 and it was so good. Zero issues. So I got premium to get rid of ads when I got my first job, lost said job and went back to free. It was so much different. Then I was able to get premium again for a bit, on and off. I had the free version two months ago and it was not this awful. I don't mind an album on shuffle but why is it playing random f-king songs??? I'm giving up on Spotify.

I've been using Spotify for about a year now after making the switch from Apple Music. I have multiple phones, one of which being a Google Pixel 6a (Android 15). and I found a bug in the song queue. When you try to remove a song from the queue, it doesn't get removed, sometimes it skips over that song because it was deleted, but it's only sometimes, and it never disappears from the list. Works fine on my Samsung Galaxy S24 Ultra (Android 14).

The app is good overall for me. But the issue I don't like is the ads, it gets annoying when the ad says enjoy 30 miniutes of ad free music. After 1 or 2 songs I get a ad. The only way I found to listen to songs on my liked playlist ad free was closing the app and reopening it. This somehow got rid of the ad and went to the next song. But that just gives extra work for you to do! I feel like they purposely give a lot of ads to try and get you to buy premium.

The newest update doesn't let you use the genre feature under "Liked Songs" for some reason. I've been trying to fiddle around with it in case it's user error or connectivity problems, but it seems to be broken still. Bummer bc I like using that feature. Update: now I cannot even tap on a song in my Library to play or interact with it. It's really frustrating...

Nor flexible enough. Update. It seems I'm not the only one frustrated with Spotify. Even when paying monthly, for premium, the app continues to get worse and worse. I spent hours, creating playlists from songs already on my phone, and a few from Spotify. But out of 100 songs in one playlist, it only plays about 20. When I manually click to play one song, it tells me the song is not available. And the album cover icons are gone. And don't tell me to contact customer service; just fix the app

The phone app for Spotify is horrible, especially if you have a free account. I hear more ads than actual music. The shuffle setting may shuffle 10 of the same songs, which is miserable for artists that have huge discographies. If an artist has new music, you likely won't hear it until months after it's released. There's a huge difference between the phone app versus if you use it on a PC, and it shouldn't be that way.

I have problems with app consistently where when you try selecting a song from your liked playlist, it doesn't do anything. It doesn't play, and you can't even queue it up because when you tap the three dots to do so, nothing happens. I can only listen to the music on my liked playlist if I shuffle play it, which shouldn't be the case considering I pay for premium and have for many years. This is a bug I have problems with all the time, through the years of updating the app too. Very annoying.

The new update is so bad!! Go back to what it was before and stop changing things when it was perfect the way you had. When I select my queue, I can no longer easily select the songs in the order by selecting the circle/ bullets on the left of the song. Now I have to select each song individually at a time and ask it to "add to queue", which takes a lot of extra time. Why would you change something that worked so well into a super irritating change like that? might have to cancel

Love it! I have no commercials, unlike YouTube.(Also love YT for talks, but they'll interrupt a song in the middle! for an ad.) Spotify let's me set up my own favorite playlists, but their algorithm also predicts me really well. That's nice. Others don't do it. Also I have found some obscure favorites. Seems like the have everything. I can look at my phone and deal with business while the music is in the background. Hope I didn't forget anything. They're tops in my book....

It's great! I really like the app, it's so much fun. But I do have to complain that sometimes, the playlists don't let you see the songs that they have and let's you click the songs that you want and play them. So it's frustrating when It does that. The ads that pop up, when you repeat the song all the way to the beginning, are also very annoying. And lastly, how you only have six skips per hour, also very annoying. But other than that, the app is great. Definitely recommend it.

I've never had so many issues where music won't play, I try scrolling through my library and the playlist doesn't load. Or when I finally get to the song I want, it automatically jumps right back to the top of the playlist when I click it. I can't put anything in my queue. I have tried with wifi on/off, switch off my VPN, deleted and reinstalled, and cleared the cache both in my phone and the app and nothing has helped. Im not going to pay from premium when I cant play my music. Too many issues.

can't even listen to the song that I clicked on. When I listen to my playlist and it finishes, it starts playing random songs instead of starting the playlist over. It won't let you restart your playlist either. The only way to stop it is to delete and reinstall the app. Also, sometimes the app will give you the next 30 minutes with no ads, but then it lies and only gives 5. The developers of this app are so greedy and horrible. Don't use. Download trebel instead.

Sound quality is excellent, all tracks are clear and sound perfect. Discover weekly has helped keep find new groups, I love this app. If you love music, this app is for you. Get the premium and enjoy music offline! Update: App is still great for music but it is terrible for getting in and out of a car, half the time the app freezes. It's been months and the app still freezes, except now it takes forever to load a song once you get it to work again.

Too hard to navigate or add songs to other playlists. Wouldn't link with my Facebook. I had to create a new account. Janky app by far. Too hard to use. Not like SoundCloud which is easy to use. Music selection is good, but too many limitations in handling music. Such as adding songs, removing songs or sharing links to songs. Impossible. I'll go elsewhere

Annoyed that the sorting options were taken away. I used to be able to sort alphabetically, by song length, by artist etc. Also just this week, every time I close the app on my phone it closes Spotify play in the background. No Rhyme or Reason to it. I didn't change anything. I tried restarting my phone. I made sure the option to continue playing when the app closes is toggled 'on'. It is so annoying I'm about ready to cancel my subscription. I Googled every possible way of fixing it.

Ever since the new update, The app has lost my use. This new update does not allow you to turn off shuffle mode, you can no longer create queues for songs, you also can't put songs on repeat, which disappoints me. not only that but you can no longer pick songs directly from the playlist, at this point Spotify is just money-hungry. If you want to turn off shuffle, pick a song, or skip songs, YOU NEED PREMIUM. Okay so they fixed the skip button issue which earns some keep on phone.

Genuinely one of the worst apps I've ever used. It has one function and does that horribly. Don't even bother with spotify support, they will always blame it on the user when there's a bug. I added a lot of songs to a playlist, and then I turn off my phone, I turn it on again and they're gone. I clear the cashe, I re install the app, I restart my phone, they're still gone. And my downloads and everything is gone too since I re installed the app, and I can't play some local file songs now.

I love this app, but the reason for 2 stars is because of the downloaded content playback. Every time, I lose wireless connection. Playback stops, and I have to restart the media. It's annoying having to restart the media every couple of minutes because I work in a wireless dead zone with no wifi. If the content is downloaded, I shouldn't have to constantly have to restart the media. It should constantly play no matter what. I've never had this problem with other media services.

I loved Spotify until my most recent update. I don't want to upgrade my account, and now i have an ad after almost every song. I can no longer choose which song I want from my Playlist, I have to scroll through and can only do 6 skips in an hour. I can't even see the song list anymore. It's ridiculous and makes me want to uninstall it. You can't even skip the ads, and it's the same three constantly. No option to tell them if it's relevant to you or not. Shouldn't have updated the app.

Yo Spotify! Bring back the way the queue worked before the update, where you can actually add and delete songs at will! This new one sucks, I can't get rid of individual songs, I have to clear the whole queue since getting rid of individual songs is no longer an option. Please fix this back to the way it was before, this is one of the dumbest things you guys have ever done.

The app is not in a horrible spot right now... but there's some sort of bug we're i go to delete a podcast from the app and it pops up with "create a list" which i obviously don't want to do because I'm deleting the item. I say it's a bug because it doesn't happen every time, but it's happening way too much to not be annoying as all get out. Now, when episodes of podcasts that are no longer on your list are still on your list. I need to find a new app. We've hit rock bottom.

Edit (01/2025) — I's only gotten worse since 2021. Still dealing with a bunch of ads, but it's down from 60+ to around 40+, which is better to some capacity. Also now, at least once a day, it plays one ad, or one song and then completely stops playing altogether. Same whenever I skip a song. Read newer reviews and a lot of people are having the same issues I am (having to restart their device/uninstall and reinstall to fix). When all you can say is "Talk to customer service" there's a problem.

I love Spotify. I use the free option. The only things I don't like is the constant emails and how you can no longer choose a song and put it on repeat. It adds songs to your Playlists, most of the time they match the other songs but sometimes it's random. Like you could have a Playlist that's just AJR and then they throw Justin Bieber in there. It's weird, but it's good for podcasts and watching shows like Helluva Boss.

The advertisements are getting out of control. Lately I've been getting three or four in a row. Also I never actually get those "30 minutes of ad-free listening"; I'm lucky if I get 10. The app also glitches sometimes, where it won't stop playing music even though I've pressed pause and closed out the app. I like it well enough, but it's not great.

It just keeps getting worse. It constantly tells you to enjoy 30 minutes of uninterrupted music, but you get 1 song and then 4 ads. Half the time, it skips to another song and charges you a skip without you touching anything. The worst thing is that having a long playlist is pointless cause it only plays the same songs over and over with maybe one change every couple of days. It used to be the best music streaming app, but know it's just an ad service.

Generally this app has gotten so much worse over time. I used to look forward to discover weekly, as it was usually full of niche stuff that I really liked. It's to a point that the only reason I'm still with Spotify is because of discover weekly, buts gotten progressively worse, with me outright blocking 25/30 of the songs they're so bad. And even then, the song I do like, I struggle to do anything besides listen to once. I got a free 3 months of YouTube music, let's see if I come back.

Spotify is and has been my go to music provider for over the span of a few years, and I would definitely recommend it to anyone I know. However, there are some major quality of life changes that must be made, such as limiting advertisement, the ads are terrible, I've gotten used to it, but if you don't want any, this is not the app for you, another issue is the fact that there is no 2-step verification made available for regular users. Regardless of the issues I have (there's more), 4/5 - 8.5/10

It's a great app to use to jam while playing games or reading a book. But I have been getting a problem with the "Jam Mode" premium that you get with it. Me and my friend is trying to listen to music together but it just isn't working. When the song changes, it kicks me out of his and if I create one and he joins mine, when I change the song it kicks him out. Could you please fix this.

Updating 1/18/25: Been a premium member for years (2009). Spotify is going downhill. I used to be a premium member but recently switched to free. I refuse to pay for songs that don't play, songs that go silent mid-song, or songs I can't find because of updates moving everything. Now that I'm a free member I hate it still. Can't even listen to a full song without it being interrupted by ads. No full songs anymore, and no rest from ads. Every song is followed by an ad. I'm switching to Pandora.

What happened to being able to remove songs from the queue? All I can do now is move the song up or down the list and set a timer. It seems that "shuffle" on "recommended for you" could use a true shuffle and not just play songs I have already listened to 2 hours ago. Also, when I skip a song, I do not want to listen to a different song from the same artist three times in a row when I'm listening to Spotify's "for you" Playlist. That's probably my first problem, trusting Spotify's AI.

I swear, this app was once the GREATEST music player app I've had! Great music choices and quality. But it has cons for the free plan users, including myself. Like for example, music is AUTOMATICALLY on shuffle, not just in playlists! I'm trying to listen to one music that I like! But from the plan I use, It always shuffles the music, and I can't even put it in loop like I used to! I'm always stuck listening to multiple songs than the one I'm planning to listen to! Nearly there Spotify!

I love spotify and have been using it since around 2019, both free and premium. I have had minor issues recently, but I do believe they are fixed. Spotify is a great choice for music and other things, with both free and premium options. I think premium is worth the price, but there's really no issue with free. The worst part about free is that there are a good amount of ads but still an amazing app.

The new queue is literally unusable. Bring back the ability to check multiple songs at once to remove!! Why do I have to manually swipe away one song at a time?? Nothing was wrong with the old queue. It did not need to be changed! This new update is clunky and took functions away that I really liked. Please just bring it back. I am considering deleting my subscription. I am so tired of this app removing features that made me like it in the first place. Please just let me have my old queue back.

-Crashes too often 👎 I can't even open the app right now, let alone play any music. -Only usable with spotify premium. Otherwise, it's literally worse than just turning on a radio. I've switched to youtube music, I can't express how relieving it is. -Why is there no queue backlog? I want to be able to see my previous songs on the queue. -Ads dont need to be 30 seconds long. Just do a little jingle and let me listen to my music again. -AI sucks.

As the service is free, I can respect that there'll be commercials. However, when I hear 'enjoy the next 30 minutes of uninterrupted music', and I get to listen to 2 songs, and then have to listen to 3 commercials, I get a bit irritated. Most songs are 3-4 minutes, so 2 songs would be 6-8 minutes. Work on your commercial algorithm Spotify!

Update: I started using this app to listen to books as well and its a rip off! After so long they want you to add 10 more liatening hours for $13!! That's a wild amount when I already pay for the premium version. Awesome app for music, it's like they understand my musical soul! One of my fave parts is the daily mixes, takes everything you know and love and shuffles in many new amazing songs, best part...different mixes for different moods!

Spotify is a classic for a reason. I like the variety of music, but I wish I did not have to pay for Premium to escape the dreaded ads. I know that's how this company pays for itself, though, so :/ I guess it makes sense... otherwise reliable and fun to use (And in my opinion, there are so many pros that they easily outweigh the cons)!

Spotify is a great music app I luv it so much. But there is one problem, when I'm listening to music and the all of the sudden The music stops playing and its jst stuck on the one song and then I have to re-open the app over and over again. Also when the song won't skip and I have to change it myself. Another thing is the ads bro, like every single time I try to listen to music there is always an ad.

5/2018 The newest update keeps crashing. A crashing app isn't what I'm paying for. If the app isn't fixed by the end of the week, I will cancel my subscription and use a different music streaming app. 1/2024 I don't know why Spotify keeps changing the filters in the liked music. Stop tinkering with things that already work. The mobile app is buggy. Update 2/14 I don't know when but they they fixed the crashing. The new music queue sucks though.

It's a really great app, but there are way too many ads... I get to listen to one song or maybe two songs, but then there are two or three adds in between each...it's really annoying. If they lowered the number of ads, it would be better...really hate to rate it a 3, but it's just from the amounts of adds... I like that this app and a sleep timer, I use it for when I'm trying to sleep and it's almost perfect👍

In my playlist, I'll choose a song then go find others to from the same playlist to play next, I tap back and it goes all the way back to the top. I see this hasn't been resolved. I reinstalled this after leaving and trying 2 others. Hated them both. Came back to worse. I turn off my car after pausing the song real quick, it just unpaused and jumped to some other song that's not even on any ot my playlists. I didn't mistakenly tap anything, screen was off, it was in the holder on the dash.

Video ads on podcast? Update : they seem to be making every effort to make money rather than provide a product so I'm reducing my rating. Spotify has a great library but after that it leaves much to be desired in terms of usability and reliability. I,ve spent countless hours trying to fix issues. They point you to a community board wich almost never fixes the issue and is very hard to use. They constantly change their software making it a nightmare to manage my playlist. I'm a premium subscriber

The app is a good way to listen to music, but there was a new update, and it was terrible, I can't play one song in my playlist, there is random songs in my playlist I've never heard and they are terrible, also I'm annoyed of this app because it adds songs to my playlist I haven't seen in my life and once again they are terrible. Have a good day(:

I like Spotify but there's some glitches that make it annoying. 1. When I play some stations, one song plays then it pauses and I neednto exit out and play again. This happens daily. 2. I can't seem to "stop" Spotify so it shuts off of auto starting every time my phone connects to bluetooth. It's very annoying. It's a good app, when it works. Yes I have un-installed and re installed, restarted my phone too. Same glitches.

The updates contiue to have so many bugs. Now I can't view or play full albums; it always says, "somthing went wrong" (even after clearing data and reinstalling). Currently if I want to listen to a full album, I have to make a playlist and search for each song and add them individually. I think I'm gonna stop my subcription next month. Omg fix this app already. I still can't download songs and it continues to crash if I turn my screen off for more than 5 mins.

Free version, after certain amount of ads it will freeze at the end of ad and you can't listen to music even if you close and reopen app. Literally have to wait 10 minutes or so without using the app for it to reset. Than only get 30 minutes of music/ads ahain. Tons of ads now a days as well. Good thing's is app is pretty universal and you can build your own library of music if the song is on the app. With that being said most music app you can do that so doesn't make this one special.

It's okay. It has become really money hungry, though, and it shows. I can't even listen to a song without premium. Any time I use Spotify on my phone & look for a song, it's always a gosh darn playlist!!! I'm sorry but then just put your app behind a paywall if I can't simply listen to a song. This is really irritating. Not to mention, you can't rewind or go back to the last song without premium.

the app used to be great. but now it is completely useless at times. the amount of adds is completely unnecessary. Four ads every two songs is absolutely ridiculous. The thirty minute breaks aren't even there anymore, I will get the thirty minute break ad and after two songs it's giving me more ads. the shuffle option is also horrible, the algorithm always gives me the same five songs. all in all, its not great unless you pay for premium.

This app kinda sucks now. Tries to insert randomly selected songs in the middle of your playlists when you've turned off AI a dozen times that week (and it somehow turns itself back on as an option). Can't perform a normal "shuffle" option for its life. Doesn't show you new music anymore when you actually ask it to, instead choosing to show different songs from bands you've already "liked." Just gone waaay downhill in the last year especially.

I downloaded this app for the sole purpose of playing music for a RINGTONE. As simple as it seems, the developers thought otherwise. When you clicked on a song you searched for, you either get a 1 minute add bomb, or a whole other song thats not even related in any way, shape, or form. I recommend just downloading a song off a sketchy website because anyone who made this scrap yard of a ,"app", did not want convenience.

Seems to have issues restarting. Takes far too much memory up for no offline listening to be available. Daily playlists that are supposed to be On demand get locked on shuffle until I clear all cache data, sometimes all app data is necessary. And the ads!!! I get it, they need to be there to keep it free. But sometimes the same ad plays twice in a row. Sometimes the entire commercial break loops even! And it's the same 3 ads for days! Good selection and variety of music though.

I have used this app for a long time and would recommend to others. They even give free Spotify plus every so often with a survey. The only thing that I find a little buggy is the 30 minute ads. Sometimes it will say 30 minutes and be 15 but.. it can be solved if you just change the Playlist. Other than that, I love pretty much everything about it.

This app is absolutely awful. It has so many bugs and is constantly shoving ads in your face. I recently had a bug where I could only play one song at a time and it wouldn't continue on to the next in the playlist and would basically just freeze. And the only way I could listen to another song would be to go on an entirely different playlist (which would of course only be able to play one song). Please don't get this garbage, literally YouTube is better than this trash at playing music.

Spotify took away the ability to easily select and remove songs from the queue, a feature that I used very consistently to curate a list of songs I may be in the mood to listen to at that moment and get rid of ones I'm not. Especially when using larger playlists like my Liked Songs for example. The option they do have of swiping right on the songs is nearly impossible to do. And I want to be able to do this for all songs in the queue, not just added songs. Dumb decision to remove that imo.

Spotify was and is still my preferred music app however there have been issues with the app recently. Whenever I go to the "new episodes" list for podcasts, the app crashes. Often when I am using my Bluetooth headphones I can't hear music on the app, it either takes a few minutes until the volume starts to work or the sound will cut out. My headphones will work perfectly fine for other apps when this happens, it is only on Spotify when I have these issues.

If I had to delete spotify I would cry. I love how I can have pretty much every song I listen to be on here and I can find more. There is one reason why I can't give it a 5 star rating though. The ads. Every three songs I get an ad and it's not so bad till you either get 6 ads in a row making longer than two songs you could have played in that time OR the same ad over and over and over again. It gets really annoying and I have tried to hit the dislike button, but it still doesn't work. Pls fix

I love music. I pay for premium, but I'm annoyed with the app, though. I have 3500 songs on my liked Playlist, and the app only shuffles the same 30 songs over and over. This is not fun. I've tried clearing the cache. I've tried closing out the app and reshuffling. It just keeps going back to the same few songs. Come on Spotify, do better. 💚

Can't even watch videos anymore while connected to Bluetooth. Canceled my subscription. It's worth noting that Spotify did this on purpose because they (for some reason) think they need to police people's driving habits. It used to work fine. Now Bluetooth connection disables video, even when not driving. Oh well, there's better apps out there.

Even after paying for premium I still have ads before during and after podcasts. I've downloaded music albums and the playlist is not the way it was on the album when originally released. I would like to be in control in regards to when the app starts to play in my car. Even if the app has been closed, when I start my car, it starts playing the podcast or music I was listening to and I have to open and re-close the app. More issues but no more space to list them here.

I can listen to all kinds of thing on here which is good. Now there's a problem that keeps happening with my download music where it's not downloaded and doesn't play when I'm offline. I've tried the different methods and it's not working. So you people at spotify please find a way to fix this problem, otherwise it really isn't worth the 10$ subscription of I can't listen to my music offline.

Too much ads at the moment, everything has become premium. The app won't even let you BREATH without it telling you to buy premium. Can't even go back to a song, can't even CHOOSE a song from your OWN playlist. I'd say, the app has become too greedy for money. I wouldn't mind not being able to listen to it in order, listen to music on a plane, but it's completely unfair to mobile users since they are more restricted to certain areas of the app and more ads, unlike curtain devices. :(

Been using spotify for a couple years now with premium, no complaints there. Most recent update has devastated the experience. Constantly cannot skip a song or open the que without the app crashing. Won't let you keep listening without crashing unless you go to a different Playlist and start listening to it and then switch back to the previous one. It was impossible to find the bug support page or whatever so I just came here.

10x better than Amazon Music Unlimited for similar price. I should have switched to this a long time ago! Runs smoothly on my TV, Echo, PC, and phone (regardless of where I am). Easy to navigate and being able to pin playlists to the top makes it so fast to launch what I want. And there is ZERO harassment with ads to upgrade like Amazon constantly forced on me despite paying for the service. If you're debating one or the other, Spotify Premium easily trounces Amazon Music Unlimited!

Pretty much every ad break is just the same commercial played back to back, doesn't matter if you thumbs down for any reason or leave a review. Now on top of having to listen to the same ad, its starting to act up when playing music. I'll be listening through my Bluetooth headphones and it'll just cut out and close the app, open Google maps and it shuts off, reply to a text same thing. Switching to SoundCloud and not looking back.

Amazing! SO many songs! I don't know what life was like before Spotify, but I definitely don't want to go back. 4 paws up! 🐾🐾 UPDATE: The app has started to cut out during music playback. I've used 3 different Androids and a laptop with wireless headphones, ear buds and 3 speakers, all Bluetooth connections. I need help, please?

UX is getting worse and worse. Most recently they removed the alphabetical scroll, replacing it with a bar, and made the scroll harder to grab on mobile. Also, with the same update, if my screen goes to sleep or I switch apps while viewing my Liked songs, it loses the location upon return. It always goes back to the top of the playlist. Makes curation impossible and makes me want to throw my phone in frustration.

the music side of it is good. the audiobook side of it seems good a well, I can usually find a pretty good recommendation. I wish the podcast side was better, started listening to podcast here since Google podcast got deleted. I don't understand why there isn't an option to listen to oldest podcast first in the 'new episodes' playlist, also recently the app has been closing entirely when I open that specific playlist

I have been using spotify for a while now, and I don't see all the hype around it. You have to pay premium for features that other apps offer for free and the mobile settings are confusing. I have been getting recommended songs in my playlists, and when I look up how to it doesn't work. I shouldn't even have to be looking up how to turn off a simple feature, but I did. On other apps I can loop the Playlist, but I couldn't find that feature in spotify.

Terrible app, you need to pay premium just to skip more than 6 songs a day and I can't even play the specific song I want to listen to in my own liked playlist. I'd have to skip through a bunch of other random songs before I listen to the song I chose. Then again, the limited skips keeps you from doing just that as well. You may as well just use YouTube music, because at least there you can skip ads.

Ads are almost intrusive. I can't count the number of times I've got an "enjoy the next 30 minutes ad free" ad, and then ONE SONG LATER get 3 ads in a row. The only reason I don't switch to another service is because then I'd have to find a way to copy my playlists... Good for podcasts though Edit: Since my review, I have listened 3 ads for every 2 songs. Changed to 2 stars from 3. I rememver using Spotify like 5 years ago and don't remember it being NEARLY this bad.

January 28 2025. I dont know what changes spotify has made to the app lately, but they have only made it worse. Podcast episodes no longer update in my feed, the recommendation algorithm gets stuck in a loop of the same music, the menus don't refresh until after several seconds of being up which rearranges the buttons I'm mid-pressing. If It doesn't improve soon, I'll be finding a different platform.

Spotify is not good because when I try to skip through songs it says I can only skip six songs and I have to get premium and when I want to listen to a specific song I press play and it gives me a different song or just the preview. It used to not do that and the layout changed. If they put less ads and better layout of the app that would be great.

Dude, I been with Spotify long time. And every update it gets worse n worse. I thought it was smart phone, smart apps, AI and all that!! But you (Spotify) consistently just make it more difficult, and way more importantly, time consuming to make playlists, to edit the playlist that is playing, and the algorithm for recommend songs is so far off course, there is no doubt that you (Spotify) is pushing an agenda on us, come on, let us enjoy what we spend our moneys on.

I used to love Spotify- until their new update. I used to have a great time listening to music in the shower, until Spotify started playing random songs that I didn't know. I am 13 years old, and I have to skip those songs just in case they curse! I also cannot just play a random song, I have to add it to another playlist to hear more than just that stupid preview. Very unhappy with Spotify rn. I might switch to another music app that puts its customers before money. DO BETTER SPOTIFY😡😠😡😤😡!

I FREQUENTLY get the "the next 30 minutes will be advertisement free" and then still get ads after every third song in that same 30 minutes. Ads are fine (hence using the free version), but not when I'm told there won't be any and then they continue to play anyway, it's frustrating. Update a week later: I no longer get the free 30 minute ads, but every other ad break just repeats the same ad 2-3 times in a row. Also frustrating, and I do want those 30 minutes of ad free back if they work.

Won't allow customization of home screen and the ability to remove from "your shows". Automatically plays after my normal podcasts are finished and this is annoying. There are some shows I've listened to for 30 seconds and they are forever saved on my homescreen. After I'm listening to a podcast, spotify will automatically play these undesired shows. We need to ability to remove or block these shows.

If you're paying for premium, it's great for listening to music! The reason I'm only giving two stars is because as much as I love the podcasts, I'm getting very tired of hearing ads, especially casinos and gambling. I dont gamble and don't plan too! But despite that , do enjoy the podcasts , but when I pay for premium , I should get a 100% ad free experience. So , until that changes, my review will remain at 2 stars.

I've had this app for years and have premium for a majority of that time. I have always been able to search for an artist in my liked songs and Spotify would always play every song I liked with that band. Except now when the song ends the system either reshuffles or plays through the list of liked songs. It's extremely frustrating/annoying as I keep updating the app hoping it will work. I don't want to look up an artist or make a playlist; just let me play all the songs I like for that artist

Mostly good. It'd be neat if the Smart Shuffle option would actually shuffle the playlist when I select a song. Currently, if I manually choose a song, it keeps the same shuffle order it had before, just plays that song immediately. Switching playlist and coming back doesn't change this behavior. So really, it just functions as a playlist with a couple of suggested songs every now and again.

This is still a great app but I don't like the fact that they changed the way queueing works with its recent updates. Now I can't even select multiple songs from the queue to add again if I want to repeat them or delete songs from the queue if I changed my mind about it or if I accidentally add the same podcast episode twice. Bring that feature back please! It's a minor inconvenience but an annoying one.

This app has come a long way especially as far as playlist making mechanics are concerned. Unfortunately the plus icon lights up for every song that has been added to both a user made playlist and when it has been added to your liked songs playlist. While I appreciate how easy it is to add to liked (especially while driving) I don't need to know if a song has been added to any playlist I have ever made. The icon should only light if it has already been added to "Liked." Or at least hearts back🤷

Spotify is just like Pandora now. It plays the same things over and over and over again, no matter how many times you remove a song from every single playlist. Every single Playlist is basically the last one, just shuffled. DJ X is not just useless, but infuriating. Additionally, If you listen to 5 minutes of the first episode of a podcast, your entire podcast thread is "popular with listeners of that one podcast you clearly didn't like!" Complete garbage. 1/10. Not worth the subscription.

I love the app overall, but what with the music. Whenever the music plays it's an whole other song that not even associated or has been associated with the artist, and it's not working right. I had to click on a totally different song to get the sound I wanted. I'm considering that YouTube music is better now. I'm sorry but this messed up my whole mood.

The app plays one song on a playlist and then will not play another song. This has occurred on multiple attempts to play playlists for several days. The app has no customer service or error reporting functions. Update: Spotify recommended I uninstall the app. I agree. I should uninstall their app. The responsibility for repairing persistently malfunctioning software should be placed on the manufacturer, not on the user.

Worked better before the update. Now it's really slow when you open the app. And when you're done with your podcast and go to the home screen to choose the next one it takes way longer to load so you can choose. So basically it's way slower. And it only pics one type of music for recommendations. When I have a huge variety in my Playlist.

Tried it again years later and they still need to add a song dislike button to every playlist they make for you. Without it you are forced to listen to songs you don't like, over and over and over.... I cannot listen to new music on Spotify, because their algorithm then thinks I like it even if I don't. Please add this functionality, really not worth a subscription without it. Pandora can do it, why can't you?

GIVE US THE ABILITY TO MASS EDIT THE QUEUE BACK!!!! I absolutely despise this queue update, it took away the ability to add or remove multiple songs at once. That was a feature I used every single day. Plus the swiping is so clunky. I don't want swiping, I was pressing buttons. But even if you kept the swiping, please just put the dots back on the side to mass add or remove songs from the queue!!!!! Ps i don't want recommendations for my playlist when I do my playlist preview, I want to preview.

I've used Spotify on phone, and PC. PC is great! you can use almost all features minus the 6 skips per hour. But phone Spotify is just bad, cash grab Spotify. it has a very rare chance of playing the music you chose, and that gives it a one. what's the point of a music app if it doesn't play the music you want it to play!?!?

I don't often leave reviews, especially negative reviews. Usually when I don't like something I get rid of it or don't use it, and just ignore it. So understand that when I say this genuinely a terrible app to use. You can't even browse songs on Spotify anymore, each time I click on a song a, "recommend suggestion" pops us, not allowing to actually listen to the song you wanted too. It's infuriating to just not be able to select a song and listen to it and see if you like it. Would rate lower.

Lol this app sucks when you're not paying for it. Even Soundcloud is better. With free Spotify you get 6 skips an hour, you have to listen to the dogshit music that Spotify adds to your already existing and new playlists (thanks for ruining my playlists!), and to top it all off you can't even PICK which song from a playlist to listen to. Just press play and hope for the best. This app went from cool to being completely unenjoyable. Using a diff app and I suggest the same for everyone else.

The mobile app isn't intuitive at all. When I open a song link it doesn't play the song and instead starts a playlist with a random song. It also doesn't allow me to look at playlists so I can't even find the song I was trying to listen to. The ads are frequent and random and unskippable. I could go three songs with no ads then suddenly get three ads after every song. This certainly doesn't make me want to get premium if the free app doesn't even work.

The app was working at first. But for about a month now, I've noticed some changes, like I can't listen to full songs on my Liked songs album; they only play clips of the songs. When I search on songs to play, it doesn't play, and the album list looks weird now - I can't see the album cover, and the songs are arranged in a linear form instead of listed. I don't know if I'm the only one experiencing this. Could they please do something about it, or is that how it is now for non- premium users

I pay for premium so it's been nothing but amazing for me, like there is literally nothing bad about it. I would suggest premium Spotify to anyone. Although, for one month I once stopped paying for it, and the app was basically unusable. I don't even know how free-spotify users are living like that. At that point, Spotify should just be a paid app completely.

The problem has been fixed; back to 5 stars. Spotify has not been playing songs unless I click on them. This has been happening since late December 2024. I have uninstalled the app and re-downloaded it, which worked for about an hour before the problem happened again. Even if I'm playing a playlist or songs from the queue, it plays that first song and then stops. I can't skip a song and have the next song play unless I skip before the first is over. Before this, Spotify has been my #1 music app.

I usually use this app to listen to something as I am doing something, but this year had been unbelievable. Ads (especially about premium), no skips and not allowed to pick which song you'd like to listen from your playlist. I think this is crazy since I don't see people paying for a membership if they just want to hear a tune once in awhile. Sometimes, the app will cut off your current song and switch to another. I also hate it when it switches to a whole different music type?!

A lot of money for an app that glitches and doesn't work. I've been using Spotify for more than a year nonstop now and I see why my friends stopped paying. Right now im struggling to get the loop button to work. It just skips right to the next song when the songs done, but then when I accidentally toggle it on and don't want to hear a song twice it works. Ironic

Free Spotify sucks due to the lack of choice in songs. Premium is pretty good. It's a solid pick for music and even audiobooks. However, the fact that songs and playlists can go down for an indefinite time due to copyright issues really sucks. Good luck finding indie covers or remixes. My final straw was when I couldn't find a song after searching it. Instead I found it in a playlist. Seems like the song was shadowbanned from showing up in search and the artist's page. It's not copyright issue.

There is only one issue and it might not be from spotify, it could be my old phone that was the issue. Every time I select to save music to the SD card it would but a few days later it would be back on my phones memory. Now that I have a new phone that doesn't have an SD card I don't need to worry about it. Besides that.... THIS IS THE BEST MUSIC APP EVER!!!! I can't think of any issues I've had with it and I've been using it for atleast 5 years I believe. Keep up the good work Spotify!!!

The free version forces me to listen to music in a whole new way destructive to my listening style (I listen by album, not playlist), and with apple music costing only a dollar more per month, for infinitely better sound quality, when I decide to sign up for a subscription music service again, if Spotify doesn't have lossless music, they will have lost my premium subscription for another 6 months or more. The only thing Spotify has going for them is compatibility, and apple is catching up there.

The Spotify app is absolute dogwater. When you're trying to find a certain song, you can't, it gives something entirely different and you can't even skip it. Any playlist you try to play is completely randomized. There is no way to select a song to play from it. What kind of music app doesnt let you play what you want??? Ads are also constantly playing. Don't waste your time with the app version. Only thing good for it is able to make playlist with your friends.

Despite saying "included in premium" their audiobooks still has a "point system". You have to pay $12 a month for premium and then another $12 every 10 hours of audiobooks you listen to?? Full books should be available in premium, paying for points should be in the free membership, this is insanely stupid and a terrible choice. This app is just a downward spiral. No longer giving us the chance to listen to an ad for 30 mins of ad free music, more ads in general, shuffle doesn't properly shuffle

I've had spotify for years (without premium) and have been good, but lately it's just gotten worse and worse. 1. The "30 minuets of uninterrupted listening" has stopped working and this is not just an issue on my account/phone 2. I play a shuffled playlist and some songs are repeated before others play and also it starts playing random songs before the playlist ends/ plays all the songs in it 3. This has always been the case and isn't too bad but the daily mixes songs barley change it feels

Pretty good app, use it a lot, and have used it for a while. My only problem is the ads. Spotify I have a question Where is my 30 minutes of uninterrupted listening? Because I get the ad that says that, listen to a song, and then I get an ad right after. Seriously though, the amount of ads is annoying. After every song there's at least 2 ads. And again, I want my 30 minutes of uninterrupted listening.

Love using Spotify! But the app is so glitchy. Any time I click on "New Episodes" the app shuts down and I have to relaunch. Then podcast episodes randomly skip to the next one on the queue without me clicking anything, simply by opening up app again. Finally, sometimes my downloaded episodes will not load if i have a spotty connection which is weird because they're downloaded... they shouldn't require internet connection.

I've been with Spotify since almost when they started there hasn't been a song I've not been able to find even from albums that are hard to find that are no longer being produced and havent been for years. Spotify had it. Hands down best music platform everything for 10 bucks a month. Less than 40 cents a day, you can't beat it. I had a major accident at work and have been financially strapped so I have only been able to use the free plan for some time now. Does Seem to be more commercials

Sorry if this is a bit blunt or rude, however I'm absolutely sick of an issue you guys refuse to fix. Not only on console but mobile as well. The ads will freeze up the entire app and will remain stuck on the ad until the app is restarted and sometimes not even that fixes it. It's been a KNOWN bug on console for years! And I'm stuck here wondering why you guys haven't done a patch for it or even attempted to address it from what I've seen. It just sucks how us free users get stuck with this bug.

Spotify does great when it comes to finding and consolidating the music you like. That's about where my enjoyment ends. Been paying for premium for over 4 years and still find it aggravating enough that the Alexa in my kitchen has a better understanding of genre fluidity and theme than this app. Leaving a 2 star review purely for the fact that even on smart shuffle, you will still have a terrible flow to your music. Curate VERY specific playlists. Otherwise, you'll be just as annoyed

Could use some improvements. The music discovery features aren't very good. Also the little short music videos that play on repeat with the songs are pointless. Biggest complaint, navigating to an artists page from a song that's playing and then to that album is very unintuitive. You have to click the artist name which is tiny and then scroll go find the album the song is playing from. It's very unintuitive IMO 👍

Really the app can be good..... But because they have to create so many different versions for so many different devices it ends up becoming a pain to use. Simple actions like connecting earbuds or simply playing music from daily mixes can be a chore. Constantly having to close and reopen the app because it doesn't want to play through my speakers or headphones. Music not playing that's downloaded because I'm "offline". The app sucks and I recommend people start buying CDs again...

When it works it's fine, but for an app that's been around for so long, it's amazing that it has as many technical issues as it has. Podcasts I haven't listened to are marked as listed to, ones I have listened to aren't marked as listened to, search function isn't always helpful (especially if searching for a playlist by someone), frequent issue with volume when connecting to other devices, suddenly jumps from the middle of one podcast to a totally different one sometimes... the list goes on.

The app is always being tampered with, as if it has a mind of its own. Always intrusive. Always pushing pointless recommendations. Always changing settings. Always navigating randomly. Can't simply be a simple player. All the people at Spotify that are pushing these pointless features are clearly incompetent. The fact that the CEO is completely oblivious to these madness suggest that he/she is also incompetent. Spotify is an old app, by now it should be very stable and consistent.

Had to lower my previous 5 star review. Spotify, the new way you can rearrange and reorder your upcoming songs is super annoying. Now, instead of selecting multiple songs to move up to the top of the list, I have to move them one by one. Not so bad for the 10 or so at the top of the list, but if I need to move several from the bottom, I have to scroll back down for every single one. Not a helpful update at all. The new look is fine, but please bring back the ability to select multiple songs.

Hate it auto connects in my car. I need to listen to audio messages while driving and I can't. Each time I connect to Bluetooth it auto plays and I can't hear. I CONSTANTLY have to disconnect my Bluetooth to prevent this. It's HELLA annoying. There isn't a feature in the app or the car to stop it. It's not under playback. I tried all buttons there.

I'll go back to 5 stars when you fix your app. I have 4,000+ songs in my playlist and I always out it on shuffle. The past few days I'll be listening to songs and then have to get out of the car so I pause it and DON'T close the app. When I hit play whatever song is on will finish but the next song is a song I just listened to and so on.... Didn't have this problem until like I said a few days ago!! HELP!! :(

This app sucks. For years, I have been trying to discover and keep up with new music by playing different playlists on Spotify, and adding whatever songs I like to my Liked Songs playlist. I have thousands of songs on that playlist at this point. But whenever I listen to that playlist, which I do a lot, it always plays the same few dozen songs, over and over again. The whole reason I use this app is that I want to hear new songs, and I don't want to hear the same thing all the time. FAIL!

All the issues I've had with Spotify have been fixed! I can now restart my phone without having to redownload all the songs to my SD card. Local FLACs also work on the app apparently. If anything one thing that would make the experience better is being able to change the song and album names and covers like apple music, and maybe even add the albums from local files into the library. otherwise it's great!

Those algorithms are the worst. Playing the same songs all the time. The same probably 100 songs all the time, although my list is around 2000. Super lame Android TV app, Navigation is awful. Have to go back to my lists all the time to play my music... Cannot even se my list playing.. Boooh app, the worst. Giving only 2 rotten starrr. The worst app... I could have given —2 starts had it been possible

I love Spotify, and I've been using it for years. But the newest update with the app and changing the queue I don't like. I can't remove songs anymore, and it's pretty annoying for me, especially when I'm in a specific mood and don't feel like listening to a particular genre. I'd usually go through the queue and change what songs are up next. Now, I can't figure it out anymore.

Most recent update has caused the app to repeatedly crash on Android a54. I think it has something to do with local files, as when you scroll down a playlist containing a local file, the app crashes. The app also crashes when you attempt to play a song in a playlist with a local file after a few seconds. I'll delete this review when the issue is fixed.

Ads play despite paying for premium! "Smart" integration with Google Nest smart speakers is awful...for example nest hub display is connected to my wife's Spotify, and she is playing her music, I will get in the car to drive to work and her music switches to my phone! Basically I can't use Spotify at all on my phone while she is listening on the smart speaker because whatever she plays comes to my phone and and vice versa. Been going on for months. I end up having to use Pandora. Useless!

I wish I could give spotify a -5 star review. Any time my phone signal drops slightly or try to play offline. The app crashes 30 seconds into a song. Regardless if I "downloaded" a song or not. I have opened multiple tickets and scoured the internet looking for a fix. Nothing works. The app keeps crashing. Nothing the support team recommends fixes this issue. This app will constantly crash unless you prefect signal.

My computer finally gave out and now I have to deal with this garbage mobile app to listen to music. I can't open any other apps when I'm listening without risking the music stopping and even disappearing from the swipe down task bar. It doesn't just pause, it's like the app restarts because the song will have to load and start over too. I don't have data saver on, it has full permission to play in the background, my Internet connection is fine, and it even does it when in offline mode

Extremely laggy, and super inaccurate. I watched an ad and it said "30 minutes of uninterrupted music" then it played one song and I recieved another ad. And after skipping 3 songs, it doesn't let me skip anymore and it says that I used all 6 skips. I started listening to music at 8 and only skipped 4 times, then I listened to music again at 10 and only got to skip 3 times before it didn't let me skip anymore. This whole app is so laggy it made my phone shut off.

I hate it!! The worst experience ever! I have to click on a single title song for so long only for it not to play. Not only that but the app takes hours or may not even load up and I'm forever just stuck on a loading screen. And sometimes when I do click on the music and it does load, it doesn't play the music and if it does play music it's not from the right song!!! It's so frustrating and I hate this app so much!!!!! 😡

music is basically my life source, but honestly this has gone down in quality so much. you get like two songs and then like 5 30 second ads. also everytime I leave the app it pauses, or it'll pause randomly. all permissions are enabled, I clear cashe regularly, I made sure to turn off battery optimization and the app is up to date, so I know it's not a problem on my side. have several other friends with the exact same issue, they moved to other apps because it still hasn't been fixed.

While you cannot best the sheer library of content, Spotify has really dropped the ball lately with a few things. One, allowing podcasts to play in-conversation advertising kind of defeats the while paying for premium to not ads. Also, the AI DJ repeatedly plays the same songs over and over ad nauseum. Lastly, when are we finally going to get lossless or HD audio?? If those three things were addressed, this would be a 5 and no other platform would be close.

A great app, wish the service was cheaper, especially since many of the playlist recommendations seem to be ad driven (popular, new music artists). For some reason, my account reset "listened to" episodes of one of my podcasts. I thought it was a device cache issue, but when I cleared it, etc., it was still showing not played. Also, the notification keep showing new episodes, even though I have listened to all available.

I pay for premium, but unsure if it's worth it, especially as functionality has NEVER improved in a decade. Really wish you could quickly remove an entire album from a playlist on mobile app. Annoying that it starts playing random music or music I listened to days ago. Often doesn't communicate with speaker. Often loops things even though I turn that off.

Spotify is amazing When you have premium. It really is worth it if you're a music head like me. My only problem with it right now is my liked song's. For some reason I haven't been able to just click and play the song instantly if I scroll too down. It also isn't that far until that happens and I have 5 thousand song's on my liked song's playlist. The same thing happens if I use the search bar to find a specific song. I can put in in que and be able to play it but I wish this could be fixed.4.7

It's nice streaming music for free. Outside of the excessive advertising Yes Spotify...i comprehend the difference between the subscription model and the free model. What i lack in understanding is how the advertising, specifically on the Google android platform, has gotten so excessive and abrasive..there's very little to differentiate between Spotify and Pandora at this point. The Subscription model is the worst thing possible and it's not sustainable. Neither is endless advertising.

Not sure what prompted us premium users to start getting ads but YOU need to fix it. It's unacceptable for a bug like that to make it through "testing". If you don't, you can plan on losing A LOT of customers to Amazon music and Tidal, including myself. Anyone affected should also get their subscription money back for the months affected. Good business practice goes a long way with consumers

Love it. Do have one request, though. When listening to the DJ, the songs are cut shorter, like a song will end sooner than the song should, and the next song is already 10+ seconds in, all at the same time... it's off-putting.
