Could you have it to where the songs are more true to the start and end? Can they mash only 5-7 seconds instead of the current time length... Thank you! Appreciate yall!

Keep auto-update off. Every "upgrade" makes it worse. Smart shuffle option will never interest me, they try to reinvent the wheel with needless changes to functional features (ie removing the button that you use to precisely scroll through songs, adding "smart shuffle", and the worst imo is removing the "like" option- all you can do is add or remove songs to your liked songs list. So irritating). Keep it to the features that we need, stop trying to be innovative w it, just keep it simple to use.

More and more ads. The 30 min of uninterrupted listening isn't there. Can't listen to tracks that friends send, due to the random feature. When starting a new Playlist the second track will be from the previously listened Playlist. The app pushes new trendy tracks, and plays artists I would never listen to. It's a good podcast and Playlist platform but it feels like it's turning away from user experience /Exploring.

Great app, been using it for years. I am writing this review because I am tired of the app prioritizing censored/edited versions of songs and making me specifically look up the original version of albums if I want to listen to them. I pay for the premium service, and I am an adult. The original versions of songs should be prioritized unless you turn explicit content off! I will change my review if this is ever resolved.

Horrendous desktop application. Desktop computer app has potential to be best version, but has terrible management. Headphones connected to computer randomly stop working internal to Spotify desktop app alone. Poor updates. No device playback configuration menu. Hard to download and transfer MP3 conversions with quality. Adding and removing songs is barely being streamlined as a feature, and is still horrendous. Menu for song adding and playlist management could be expanded to cover screen.

If you have free, it's not really worth it. You can only skip a certain number of songs and sometimes can't look at lyrics. Often when im listening and it gives me 30 minutes without ads, it is not even 15 before one shows up. You can listen is to songs but after like 3 songs, Spotify gives you sometimes up to 5 ads that you cannot skip. You cannot choose what songs you listen to either specifically. You can play playlist and add songs, but you can't pick a song and listen to it

Honestly has gone downhill. I do like the fact you can play music when not in the app but that's really the only good part about it anymore. Tons of adds, and even when you get the "30 minutes" of uninterrupted music it still doesn't work half the time. Limited skips and unable to pick the songs you want is absolutely stupid.

🌈This app just today shows a blank screen and says just a moment, and nothing happens! Our songs downloaded for offline playback are not anywhere to be found, and we know our tablet very, very well! The last issue is that when Bluetooth connected to our vehicle, the volume limit on our tablet glitches, and basically, we have little if no control over the tablet and very difficult to shut down! Only when we're using this app, other than those problems, the sound is great, along with °SOUND° app!

I am constantly having issues with this app I swear 🤦🏻‍♀️ Edit to add: I have to uninstall and reinstall it every once in a while because it freezes up and today I learned if you pay for the month but make any changes during the pay period (like accepting an offer for duo) it does cancel out the money you've already paid and you have to pay again. Make sure you don't make any changes until the bill is due.

Terrible app. Scalps loyal users. If you ever have Spotify basic (which is still paid) and you upgraded to duo premium or any other service, you can NEVER go back to Spotify basic. It says so on their website. You are stuck with the audiobook premium charge. So now I am cursed to forever pay an extra buck and some change per month for audiobooks that I will never listen to. I hate this app. I only use it because I already have my 2000+ songs on it . Been on Spotify 10 years. Straight garbage

It is worthless if you do not pay ELEVEN dollars a month for the premium version. I can buy a CD for that much and have it forever. If I saved up money for six months, I could have four or five CDs that I own forever! Save your money and phone storage. The app is trash. I would rather listen to the birds outside chirping FOR FREE than listen to two songs and then three of the same ads I have heard twenty times before. Saves me from having to buy blood pressure medication in the future, too.

On phone I can't even play the full song without either being sent to a group of songs that play after the song I want is done. My Playlist is also broken because it only plays a part of a song when I tap it. There's also so many knockoff songs that I can't get past when I want to search for a song for my alarm. Not worth it on a phone if you're planning to get

I've had Spotify for going on 14 years and I only had Spotify premium maybe a year. I do not currently have it but I definitely feel like it is more ads than songs on Spotify currently and that is very irritating. Every time it "says here's 30 minutes of ad-free music" . It might be 5 minutes without an ad at this point. It's false advertising and does not encourage me to want to pay for Spotify premium again. It's actually encouraging me to go to a different music app.

It's becoming like those dang scammy websites that pull up ads every two seconds to where I can't even search a song without being sent to some dumb website because an ad. Then to make it even better I can't even play a song in my Playlist. I have to listen to every other song, that sometimes repeat, to then get to the song I want to listen to. By then I don't even want to listen to that song. 🫠

The latest version on my android device interrupts normal functions of Quick Settings, the pull-down shade menu that navigates system settings like "Dim", "Night Mode", and "Wifi". They become unoperable in some instances, where selecting them activates some selection animation on the icon but nothing happens; Wifi can't be accessed, Dimming won't work, and I won't be sent to Night Mode settings. I'll change the review once I get normal functions of my device, but this issues been for a while..

To be honest, I used to really like this app and still pay for premium. However, things like refusing to play personally downloaded music and the random tendency to forget I have stuff downloaded through the app has become far more common than it used to be. In addition, smart shuffle is the most useless feature imaginable, and there is no option to completely and forever opt out. It just sits there bloated, worthless, and causing other playback problems. I've updated my review. Lags like hell.

App itself great, I've been using it for years. HOWEVER - it is the most expensive monthly subscription my husband and I pay for, and now I learn there are only so many hours of audiobooks I can listen to a month? And an extra 10 hours is 12.99?! That is 75% of what we pay for our monthly subscription. Seems super overpriced and a pure money-grab. If there is no limits for music, why would there be for audiobooks?

Been using Spotify for years, as of recently I've been getting nothing but crashes and bugs. The most infuriating one is Spotify suddenly stops liking new songs, adding songs to pre-existing playlists, and downloading music. It just suddenly stops being in sync with current changes. I do not want to have to continuously uninstall, reinstall, and spend a day redownloading all my music. It makes it really hard to enjoy using the app like I used to.

I used to love Spotify. I've been a member for YEARS. But I'm pretty close to cancelling my membership bc the app just keeps running slowly. Why does it take an entire 5 minutes to load the home screen? I don't understand. I cleared the cache, uninstalled it multiple times, test my phone, etc. still the problem persists. This has been a common issue particularly amongst android users and Spotify does nothing to fix it. Ridiculous.

New review: Every time I close the app and reopen it, my Playlist has jumped to the top of the list, which forces me to scroll down and find the spot I'm at. I can't tell you how annoying this is as someone who has THOUSANDS of songs in their Liked playlist and genuinely listens to all of them. Having to scroll through anywhere between 100-2,000+ songs to get back to the spot I'm on is aggravating and honestly making me want to hop on YT Music.

Absolutely HATE the new queue UI. I can't select multiple songs anymore or remove songs from my queue, and they've just made it really clunky to add things to my queue. After they removed the double tap to like feature I was already feeling :/ but this was too much. If I didn't use it so much I'd consider ending my subscription and going to another service but I have too many hours invested in playlists and podcasts. Really disappointing.

Never should have re-downloaded, it's worse than when I left.Adding songs automatically with a algorithm that doesn't understand that I don't want remixes of songs that were perfectly fine. And now you can't even view your own playlists. Like I can't even see the songs that I added to my own playlist, can't even view the track list. Can only see the garbage their AI wants to add. Pointless and ridiculous. Oh but if I paid for premium I would be SO LUCKY I COULD VIEW MY OWN PLAYLISTS. DISGUSTING

Math doesn't lie ! You get every feature & function that the other 3 contenders offer, and then some with Spotify ! Loads & installs fast and smooth on every platform I've seen so far. This music app is by far the easiest to use, especially with all the features it offers up. Spotify's expanded library is second only to the Library Of Congress, really, check it out ! But the knock out punch it delivers to the other services is it's price, more bang for the buck at a price they can't match !

Used this app for years, and I still use it because at over 6k songs, I'm not switching without a good reason to. I'm giving it 2 stars because for ✨️whatever possible reason✨️ with every update, this app continues to become slower and have more technical issues. It's only saving grace is that it's still usable or else I'd give it -4/+5 stars because this is ridiculous. It went from quick and easy to resetting if I skip through my songs to fast. Do better.

lowkey sad that when i try and look for songs again, the bar doesnt show that helpful little icon with the letter youre on, as well as the songs black out while scrolling so sometimes i scroll way too far. just a nitpick, everything else is fine for me since i like to hyperfixate on certain songs and it learned to know that and repeat it, but some songs arent as repeatable but still recommends it to me. no idea what they updated really, barely noticeable

Switched to Spotify after Google podcasts and Stitcher shut down, and I don't like it AT ALL. It is not intuitive and very clunky to find just the podcasts you're subscribed to, and once you finish one, it starts playing who knows what randomly. Very thankful I didn't have kids in the car when I finished a podcast and it randomly started playing a song full of f-bombs from a band I'd never heard of. I would switch immediately, but at least it has a good selection of shows I can't get elsewhere.

Great music! Definitely recommend. Love the Spotify Wrapped at the end of the year that's something I look forward to all year. Also the music recommendations are bad and good depends on where you get them recommend songs are usually bad but playlists can vary in my opinion. I would love if the explicit filter could be customized so I can listen to songs that have swearing but not songs that are blocked for other stuff or something similar to this.

I like to use this to listen to podcasts at work but recently in the last month or so when an episode finished then it moves up and starts to play the previous episode, that I already played, instead of going down the list for the next episode. Which is annoying because i have to keep going into the app to put on the acutal next episode instead of just being able to listen. I tried to uninstall and reinstall the app but it didn't help.

The app has recently gotten super buggy. It won't let me play songs from my liked songs. When I click specific songs in my 'liked songs' playlist my taps seem to be completely ignored. Also, this is off topic, but I've tried developing with their API in the past, and it is extremely limited and many of the endpoints that do exist do not work in the way they claim. The support channels for API development have not been responsive when I've asked there. Frustrating. Otherwise good product.

Fix your app so it stops auto playing when I'm in the car. I've turned off car mode and autoplay and it still automatically plays. Connected to a Bluetooth adapter, so it isn't a setting in my car. Edit: it isn't Android Auto, if you actually read my review you would see I'm not connecting to the car. It's also disabled. Fix your broken app.

My app won't let me select anything in my Playlist, it randomly starts playing after I've done and closed it multiple times, skips in the middle of the song. I've been having nothing but problems these last few months . And now it won't play at all. I updated everything and restarted my phone. And nothing seems to help it play. PLEASE FIX!

I love Spotify in that I can select songs to create my own playlist. That being said however, 99% of the time I start listening to my playlist and after the first song I get a series of ads and then says that I will get 30 minutes of ad free music. One song later and I'm getting repeat ads all over again. I understand I will have to endure the ads without premium, but I don't want ads after every song. Also, the shuffle plays the same 5 songs over and over out of my 200 on my list.

All of my downloaded songs are removed repeatedly. There is no fix for this other than to redownload music. The whole point of premium is to download music to local storage. If I have to "force stop and clear cache" - which doesn't work - there's something else wrong. I'm not "clean installing" it again. These half baked solutions are akin to the classic "have you tried turning it off and back on?". As soon as I find a better alternative I'm gone.

Why Pay For Premium When Premium Features Don't Even Work?? I've used Spotify for years, and overall enjoyed the platform. Atleast with a premium membership. However one of the main selling points of premium is downloading your music for offline listening. IT DOES NOT WORK. Even after activily making sure my music is downloaded, I will try to listen without a connection or a poor connection just for nothing at all to load, and that's always the case regardless of what device I use. Pathetic.

Love spotify, I reallllly do. Long time subscriber. I really need my algorithm to be more customizable, though. I often get hit with tags that applied to one or two things I listened to that were suggested by friends, and it throws off my dj and auto generated playlists. I use the exclude from taste, but it has minimal effect. Now everything is sideways again 🤣 help me spotify. You are my only hopeeee!

Please add adaptive offline mode where it will switch back online when it has detected internet connectivity. Scenario: I go hiking/biking out of range of signal, so I turn on offline. I forget to go back online. In the meantime, no new podcast episodes will download. Next day, back on the trail and I don't have any newly downloaded content. :(

It feels like this app is trying to vice grip me into a premium subscription. I only use it for podcasts anymore. You can only skip forward a song six times in an hour if you have the Free Plan. On YouTube Music you can skip however many times you want. Ill take a delay in the song starting and ads (mostly skippable albeit) at the start of most songs apposed to what i can only describe as someone choking you with limitations so they can torture you into a subscription service.

I can't give the app 5 stars due to some annoying features. Especially when you are scrolling through your Playlist, pick a song, and then the scroll bar automatically goes back to the very top of the Playlist losing your spot. Update: changing review to 2 star as its becoming a very frustrating user experience. I tired using the smart recommendations and it recommended the same song 5 times in a half hour even though I hit the minus to remove each time.

The amount of times my DOWNLOADED SONGS won't play when I've lost signal is insane. Not sure if that's client side or not, regardless it shouldn't ever be an issue. Spotify accounts for about 1/3 of my phones local storage. Pretty disappointing. And STOP REMOVING/REPLACING the category filters in my liked songs. I should just have them all, for whenever I want to use them. It's so stupid to be a music app and not let me select the specific genre I want. WHY AM I PAYING FOR THIS?

In my personal experience great app. Love to use it. When recommending this app to co - workers or colleagues, more specifically older generations folks they tend to have a harder time navigating the user interface. Following further i don't like how they tend to raise the monthly subscription a few dollars every year or every so often. I understand that there are changes in the economy & prices fluctuate but this tends to just fluctuate up & never down. So if your looking to pay for premium get

The app works absolutely fine, playlists sometimes work and I'm able to find songs without too much trouble. The problem comes when trying to play a specific song as spotify will play it one time and then outright refuse to play it again, instead playing some random loosely related song; this would be fine if it was an issue but it's an intentional feature that will not let you listen to a specific song or use about half the apps features without paying an overprice premium fee.

It seems like with every update, listeners lose options, making the overall experience worse and worse. With the latest update, you can't remove songs from the queue that you don't want to hear. If you have an album that you like to play, and you love all but two songs, Spotify says, "Too bad. We don't care about customer experience." If you want to listen to a Playlist at work, and some songs are not customer friendly, "too bad. Spotify doesn't care." The hubris. I hope Spotify gets replaced.

When you finish a downloaded podcast it doesn't automatically go to the next downloaded one - it picks a random song or something else. Very annoying - especially in car when not easy to change. Also the display pages are terrible - no customization allowed. Recently played podcasts do not show up sometimes in list of Podcasts so you have to search for them.

A recent update broke the to hide songs I don't want to hear in Discovery weekly: On mobile I can hide a song, but on the desktop there's no option to hide, if I hid a song on mobile, it doesn't show as hidden on the desktop resulting in the song playing anyway. Support told me to submit a feature request, but this is literally a bug they introduced! The algorithm is also jacked up and keeps recommending yoga class music. I didn't ask for this. Overall it makes discovery weekly useless to me.

This used to be my go-to app for music and podcasts. We have premium for the family, so we can all access our own playlists. However, starting about a month ago whenever I open the app 1- I'm not logged in anymore, and 2- within 10 seconds it forces my phone to restart. Not seeing much point to keeping the family plan for premium if we can't all use it.

It plays half way through a song and then quits. I have rebooted and updated but it continues. It will also repeat songs over and over during shuffling. It won't play all my music. I am not paying for this and I'm guessing that will be your only solution. Spotify used to be good but now I'm going back to Pandora because I don't have problems there.

It's a good app, lots of audiobooks, podcasts, and artists to pick from, I've found some of my favorite artists from the generated playlists, my only problem is the ads, that do have multiple ways you can pay for Spotify premium, but sometimes you'll go through two songs and then bam, 4 ads, I know I'm on the free version but listening to three four songs and then an ad is a little annoying

I love this app it has lots of music choices,lots of popular singers to not popular. The also have lots of podcasts funny, ture crime ,talk shows. The adds can get annoying at times because you get the same ones over and over . You get at about one 20-30 secend add for every 2-3 songs so not to bad . This is probably the best music lisning app out their so 5/5!!!

I absolutely love Spotify, it's my number one app that I use when listening to music for anything, but recently it has become personally too strict with what features are premium. I'm fine with ads and everything, but I can't even play a different song in a playlist or play music in the order that it is in the playlist and not to mention I can't even rewind or fast-forward a song. It's a great app but not everything has to be premium.

All good until you start getting the songs in the language you don't understand. Most artists I listen to sings in multiple languages. And I only understand one of those. This app doesn't allow to set the language of the songs I want to listen to. It asks for more money even to skip the songs as well. There are other issues as well. Note to the Spotify people: Don't respond asking me to contact support. We all know it's useless. Fix this, and I'll change my rating.

I've had a premium subscription for 7 years, and I stopped paying because I dont believe it's worth it to spend over $17 for one person to listen to music. The ads are ridiculous if you are not a subscriber. Also, it will just stop playing songs out of nowhere. The app has seriously gone downhill. It used to be my favorite. The last comment i posted replied, "I should subscribe to premium." NO ONE EVEN COMMENTS AND SAYS THEYLL FIX IT ANYMORE. USELESS.

Had this app for years and one issue I've noticed that's never been fixed is when I listen to a playlist I've made with well over 50 songs in it. Even if I have shuffle on, Spotify will loop the first 15 songs over and over again. Even if I manually switch the song to something it hasn't played yet, it will go back to playing the same previous songs. Now i cant even play my liked songs? It refuses to open the Playlist. I'm seriously considering canceling my membership and deleting the app.

Not the best. I have almost 2000 liked songs and it will play the same 60 songs if I use shuffle. The most recent update changed it so when I view upcoming songs in a playlist I can only rearrange them and not remove them. I can see how the rearranging would be useful, but to remove one for the other doesn't seem logical. Why not keep the previous feature and ADD to it as an improvement? When I use the scroll bar, it no longer shows which letter of the alphabet I am on. Now I have to guess.

I'm not paying for premium because that's just ridiculous. But free Spotify users should not be getting this many ads, and there should be more skips. Also, I hate trying to play one song but getting 100 completely different ones before hearing the song I wanted. Plus, you should be able to play songs in any order. Premium is dumb to me; why can't we just have free Spotify? On browser tab, I can play the songs however I want and with unlimited repeats. Why not the same on mobile?

Works fine on all my other devices but my Google TV. The song plays but no sound at all. This is the 1st time that I have issues with this app. My whole family has used this app for years with no issues. Works on my Roku and Fire stick just fine. But I would love it in my living room. Plz work to fix the issue.

I really like this app I, but recently there have been why more adds than there were when I first downloaded spotify. There are times when there will be 3 adds after every song and there's no way to skip them. Spotify has an option that allows you to say if you like the add that you got or not if you click the thumbs down one of the things you can say about the add is "I'm getting this add to often" but after I click this I get that same add even more than before and even several times in a row.

This app is lacking in almost everyway, you can't hide/block specific songs episodes or podcasts, if watch one episode of a podcast and it won't stop showing up in the home menu even if your not following the podcast. no matter what you do it'll keep popping back up whenever they upload. This situation has been going on for over a year now, even after plenty of people suggesting to add the feature. Canvas doesn't work on some devices after years of using this app. Might switch to an alternative.

Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 5 user here. I can't simply select and play any song. I literally have to add them to my queue then hit next. If I pick a song it freezes the music, I have to find one it will allow me to play which is VERY few then I have to locate the song I wanted to listen to then add it to my queue then hit next to play it. It also deletes the playlist genre filter. I can no longer filter out Chill, Upbeat, or Electronic songs. I already tried deleting it twice and have premium too!

Spotify as a service - it's fine. Family premium plan = no ads to interrupt music/podcasts (other than what the podcasts have themselves) Playlists repeat the same artists/songs. Worst issue? The app will start playing the joe Rogan Experience twice a week. I've never voluntarily listened to an episode of the podcast, never searched for it. It's like I'm being forced to listen to it. Contacted customer service, no help. No way to block the show, basically done with the app as a whole.

I've used spotify for years, it had been my only app for music. However it's now unusable. First it was that it would only play one song and then stop, that went on for weeks. So I switched to something else, but then spotify worked with no problems. Now because of the new scroll feature I can only look at couple of songs, it won't show me anymore. I want to like spotify again but I'm starting to think I need to move on.

It has a lot of great features for discovering songs and making playlists. I don't like the new explore shuffle option. It keeps causing delays when I'm trying to turn off shuffle. The app home screen is much easier to navigate and no longer auto plays videos and pauses searching. I need car mode back. Also, artists need fair compensation for their art.

It's okay but I have some complaints. I don't like that I can't add songs to a que and have them stay there. I have bad anxiety and listen to songs/playlists on repeat. I have to empty a temporary playlist and add new songs every so often. In the last month, it has logged me out 5 times, most of them were while I was listening. Tried my password, wrong one. Made a new password, and it still says it's wrong. I have to go to my email app every time I log in.

Loved the app until it decided to keep playing in the background even though all of its permissions have been revoked. I will be listening to my audiobook in another app and it will intrusively decide to play music. I can even have not opened the app for weeks and it will just decide to play the moment I open my phone. I've undone every single setting I can think of, even wanted to disable the app, but there's no setting for that. I am about to uninstall it until I'm ready to listen to my music.

It's been 3 weeks of my playlists constantly refreshing to the same spot if I minimize the app or just set my phone down to listen. I spoke to customer service last week, tried every suggestion until we concluded it was bc I had an older phone that couldn't update to the latest version of Android. Well, I ended up needing to replace that phone anyway, but now it's doing the same thing on a Pixel 9. So what's the answer now, Spotify? This is beyond annoying.

Great for listening to music bad for anything else. Trying to find new music sucks trying to make a Playlist is time consuming as hell and even just sorting your liked songs is terrible. 1500 songs and i get like 5 genres to sort it into and it cuts out 90% of what i would want to listen to in that genre and adds a bunch of stuff thats barely considered what i sorted it by.

Spotify is very useful, contains many other option than music Informative i would like to explore or music not just the genre I like, keep asking me would I like it consider to listen to not just what I've placed as a preference. I know there is always something that can be classical, monolithic or experimental in music and I would like to explore greater possibilities. Trice..

The app was much better when it was all about the music but since it's about algorithms now and an unwanted and broken smart shuffle that tries to make you listen to music that you haven't added to your library, it honestly sucks. I created playlists the way I want to listen to them, not the way an algorithm decides I should. Stop trying to do so much Spotify and just do what you did best before all this extra nonsense!

(Edit: I hate the new queue) Every time I try to turn off smart shuffle and I have something in queue it skips forward. Please just let it be an option in settings to turn it off completely. Also I'd like if the DJ didn't have sets completely unrelated to my music taste. There's been some crashes and audio problems too lately. My music will often change volumes a couple times. Other than this I love Spotify and recommend it highly.

I would really appreciate the ability to select multiple liked songs and move them to separate playlist instead of selecting one at a time. New updates should focus on organization and functionality for the user. Better recommended algorithm that doesn't keep suggesting the same songs. If I skip a song that could indicate I don't like it. Been a premium user for like 6 years. Help us out.

Update comes with major bugs. Unfortunately as of Jan '25, the app keeps crashing consistantly & its such a pain. To compound my woes, Samsung has done away with native music players so this is my only option to play my downloaded music without tons of ads but paying for premium with these bugs is moot. My robust playlists? Unaccessible. Mp3 files on phone? Unaccessible. Patience? Has run thin as paper.

I don't really understand the design approach on the app recently. Weird things get added and removed for seemingly no reason. For example, the new + on the bottom bar serves no purpose and makes it harder to reach the Your Library button. It's like they just throw things at the wall and see what sticks with no UIUX testing. As a user, I'd prefer they fix actual problems like the "Added to [playlist]" toast message sometimes covering key elements on the page like the bottom nav bar.

It is what you pay for these days. And ever since I left Premium behind back in 2016, the ads are getting every more prevalent. Luckily since the advent of streaming services, there a decent amount of free competitors that let you play your own library ad free, and I will continue to use Spotify to listen to music exclusively there, but I do miss the glory days of a 30 minutes ad free period when it was 30 minutes.

I don't understand why this app is so slow. It never loads anything and never registers me selecting music. If it does register me selecting a song it takes a whole 5-10 seconds to register it so half the time I don't know if it's working or not because it usually doesn't. Anyways I have decided I am going to YT Music. Seems like a better deal at this point.

Have Spotify premium, good in playing music but awful at helping when there is an issue. Been trying to get help with my Spotify playing a different playlist than the one I'm choosing. It plays one song from the playlist I choose before going complete bonkers and playing songs that aren't even remotely similar to the to the playlist originally chosen. It won't show what song is playing on any of my playlists either. I've tried logging out and logging in, restarting my device, and re installing.

No all songs tab? Every other music streaming app has this feature. There should be a tab that shows all songs from all saved albums regardless of whether each song has been "liked". The liked playlist is for favorites, not the entire library. This is embarrassing that a music app as big as Spotify doesn't have such a simple feature. Music organization is clunky and barely an option because of this

I'm not sure what current issues are about that some are having but I used the cards one could buy for $10 and had few issues if any. However, my life has changed and have a new device and can't afford even the $10 I paid almost a year ago (3/24). The adds are a bit much I agree, but what does one expect from something for FREE?!? Stop being entitled babies and be grateful for what you get or PAY to get more!! Lol. Thanks Spotify for making the good/bad days better!!

It would be nice to be able to find a recently played song. For some reason I can't find the song I just listened to 10 seconds ago. I still love the app but come on, you guys are making me work harder than I should to find a song I was just listening to 10 seconds ago. I googled how to find a recently played song and it was impossible because what was stated in the instructions didn't align with the updated version as of 24Feb2025. This is the first problem I've had since 2016

It would probably be 5 stars if there weren't so many features missing from the free version. You can't choose what song you want to listen to, only what Playlist; you can't go back to the song you just listened to so you're out of luck if you accidentally skip a song; you only have 6 skips per hour and only 30 minutes without ads. Seeing lyrics is a premium feature too. I feel as if Spotify is too greedy. It's a good app if you pay $11.99 per month.

No matter where I have traveled, thus far, I have been able to search for singers in the regions traveled. Additionally, I can get all my saved lists and still collaborate with my friends, sharing my new musical finds. And I have really enjoyed all the podcasts. I'm glad I switched from that other big name music system. I feel I have fewer limits on the Spotify network. Keep up the great work!

Spotify buggy asf. I have android with ads, and when I connect any Bluetooth, it will go into an infinite skip cycle, ignoring my Spotify skips limit. I opened the app to find literally every playlist I have (saved, created, Spotify made) is completely empty. Don't tell me to log out or reset my phone. I've tried all the "just do this" fixes. I'm switching to Amazon music bruh this the last straw.

They took away the ability to watch podcasts while Spotify is connected to the vehicle sound system. I am a truck driver, and sometimes when I'm relaxing, I like to connect Spotify to the vehicle sound system. Now, the Spotify app identifies my truck stereo as an automotive stereo and locks me out from being able to view the video. I'm uncertain of why Spotify suddenly finds it necessary to police their paying customers. I'm a big boy! It's not your responsibility!

Long time premium subscriber, but these endless updates and changes to the UI are ruining the app. Been using Spotify, since the days when you had to upload your own music libraries to it. The last update wrecked the functionality of the quing features... Idk what's wrong with the app developers, they can't just leave well enough alone. I suppose, once the app is nearly perfected, they gotta justify their pointless employment somehow. Ridiculous.

I've used spotify for years now and it's been a great platform. But as of a few weeks ago spotify has been kicking me out of the app all of a sudden. I feel like it's a bug in the app because I've tried everything from restarting my phone to clearing my cache. I really hope they can get this fixed so I don't have to move to another platform.

I love this app so much, I will listen to hours of music on it! However, there are a lot of ads, it will tell you that you are going to get 30 minutes of uninterrupted listening and then I play a 3 minute song and have a bunch of ads after it. Overall it is really nice though! You can blend playlists with friends and each year around Christmas get a special Spotify Wrapped that shows your top songs and artists for the year that I am always so excited to get! Overall it's a really great app!

I don't know why, but Spotify keeps limiting my skips and also making my playlist play random songs that are in the playlist but I want it in order. sometimes I don't feel like play certain times because all of my songs are different. Some are calm and some are long. So sometimes I would want to skip. Or I want to play a song over again,but I can't. Basically, I'm being forced to get premium just to skips as much as I want. This stops me from using this app, I really ,really want it to stop.

Latest update keeps downloaded mp3 files from being played through the app anymore. Used to be able to listen to podcasts that were downloaded from other sources and saved locally on the phone through the Spotify app. Since update, they will no longer play. Tried downloading newer files and those won't play either. Will show up on the local library folder of Spotify but will no longer play.

The app allows anyone on the same network to hijack your music (both intentionally and not). You can be listening and suddenly it's playing something else on your phone, or suddenly your music is playing in a random work conference room. It's absolutely ridiculous that this hasn't been fixed in years. I'm sick of it and I cancelled my subscription.

Auto play needs to be removed. Connecting my bluetooth, joining a meeting, driving to work, ending a call, ect. Why the heck do these mean I must want spotify to open and play in my ear automatically. As a functioning human, I can open the app when I want to use the app. As of now I'll delete once I find a moderately similar service.

I can't rewind on songs... I can only skip to the next song... ITS STUPID... other than that it would've been great.... but now a can just play the song I feel like playing in that moment...

Unable to cast through app to connected Google Home even when restarting the phone and app. iPad is able to cast to same device through the iOS app. So it's an Android app issue.

I would give this 5 Stars but if you don't pay for premium you get soo many ads everything time I listen I get 4 ads in a row that I can't skip and have hear multiple times before or that don't apply to me and whenever I hit the thumbs down on a ad it'll still show me the ad over and over and over again. I also don't like how free users can't pick what song they want to listen to but have to hope that it comes on within the 6 skips they have. Now it won't let me use the app.

Constantly crashes my phone. Looses place, ignores commands... Still no improvements in years. Refuses to update. Routinely crashes while still playing audio with no way to stop or mute. Worst podcast system I've ever seen in my life, and that includes just a single html page with an rss feed. Putting ads inside 'Spotify exclusive" content is just making me pay twice for the same product.

I love the app, I've been using it with premium for a few years now. But the updates have got to stop. The app was perfect already before the most recent update - the new and "improved" queue update. I love listening to my music, but it was entirely ruined for me tbh when I found out I had a limit of audiobook hours. Not exactly sure what is going on with the song list, but for some if I go past a section of songs and try to play a different song way down the list, it resets back to the top everytime the phone turns off. Other than that, great service, just some updates don't exactly make the app run better

2/14/25 Super slow to connect to the net wifi/broadband. Frequently hangs, goes on long loops. App needs update. Can't contact you except botchat, no humans. STOP CHANGING STUFF! The main reason I used Spotify over Apple Music is because you could select and remove multiple songs from the queue at once without swiping each one. If it wasn't for being on a family plan which I don't pay for, I would never use this app again. Spotify is rigged. Ever since yall added a.i. this thing has been rolling dowhill as fast as it can go. Ive never heard worse music in my life thanks to this app now. Ive been shown music so bad i couldnt even believe it was on such a large platform, let alone as popular as it is. The app has zero concept of your taste in music, it just plays random garbage music, and then a bunch of music you dont listen to anymore. 0/5 stars, it just doesn't let you put less than one star 👍🏻.

Without being pressured to do so, I am able to say that Spotify does exactly what it suggests that it will, the app works fine for me, I have known professionals that use it and I am not one of those. There are many choices in this category, Spotify is one of the options chosen by me for musical entertainment and other audio-ish stimulation. I like it, I use it and I recommend it.

After a few months I really wanted to enjoy it. But apple music is honestly a super power compared to this. What would be better is if it let you download albums and songs instead of having to do it in a playlist. There seems to be an obsession with playlist has just become so obsurdly annoying that I went back. If they fixed that it would be more friendly to users coming from iPhone.

I love the app but can not afford another monthly bill so i enjoy it for free WITH ads. Lately I have been hearing ads after almost every song. Sometimes 4 ads in a row. One of the ads is for a Christmas play near my area. Really? It's february! Is this just my phone, my area? I just updated the app as well and I just heard it again. Can you fix??

I have premium and it's totally worth it. The freedom to listen to whatever whenever without any interruptions is better than I thought. Its an okay compromise letting free users listen to their playlists shuffled. I'd rather have to option to listen to more ads to be given back the ability to listen to specific songs.

So tired of my music getting blasting loud then super quiet. It happens constantly. I set the volume to what I want and then within a couple minutes it double the volume then gets quiet again. Does so constantly and its so annoying especially when trying to have a conversation with someone with music in the background as we end up yelling at each other.

No problems with playback, terrific selection and good recommendations, same with its audiobooks. However it is designed to play continuously and while it's easy to set a podcast to stop, to just listen to one song takes many steps, time-limiting playback is limited to presets, and you can't play just one album.

Fix Autoplay!!! There's no setting / feature to turn off autoplay (that actually works). Every time I put in my earbuds it automatically starts playing music. Great app if you pay for premium (which I was a longtime user) but after switching to the free version I can't listen to more than 2 or 3 songs before ads pop up and thats if I can listen to any songs which more often than not I'm not even able to get through 1 song without it stopping completely if you want to pay then I'd recommend it but if not I would find a different music app to listen to

I used to love this app, but it progressively got worse. You need premium for this app, but I can't afford it, so I had to use regular which didn't seem bad til now. 4 stars, minus one for the freaking heart attack... Stopped playing download tracks when no internet connection is available. Tapping on track or album, which were downloaded, doesn't do anything. Very frustrating.. I enjoy using Spotify usually; recently they've changed the way the song queue shows up and I'm no longer able to delete songs from it. This was a feature I greatly appreciated and used often, and I would like if they put it back or made it so I was able to do this again.

Many issues. Let's get through this; Can't change the order of playlists. Why? Far too many ads. Feel like I'm watching television with how many ads this app has. my experience is horrible, there's ads that would not stop playing, it goes on and repeats even though it's done, in have to actually get off and put Spotify on, which is extremely unpleasant when I'm doing something, still one star, even after it tells me that I'll be getting a 30 minute vreak from ads, its still gives me A SONG AFTER ITS SAYS IT, its had it's better days. I used to love this app but I feel like they're getting more greedy because when you try to play one song it plays other songs that you didn't even want, you can't loop songs anymore, more ads constantly, playlist doesn't go in order with songs anymore, you only get 6 skips hour, the only thing to fix this is to pay them and you get the old Spotify back technically, I'm so sad Spotify turn worse than YouTube music :(

I love Spotify, it's my go-to source of music. I love Spotify, but I have to say I have NEVER dealt with a company as desperate and hard up as Spotify and make "10" freakin attempts to draft a payment, and this is no exaggeration!! The customer service is about the worst I have experienced. They have Premium plans which include audio books and Basic plans which do not. However, they hide Basic plans from some users. Some Features Need Improved. I really enjoy Spotify and one of my favorite features is skipping through songs with a quick swipe on the album, but it is way too sensitive to dropping the menu back to home. Then I have to tap on the song again to bring up the menu and attempt to swipe skip again.

Advertisments are louder and longer than the songs, and the fact that you have limited skips is just stupid and petty. Also, I keep on getting the same ads over and over and over again, it is really annoying and i have already tried doing the thumbs down button but it disnt do anything

Why does shuffle replay literally every single song of the last 4 hours of itself when I have 20+ hours of music on my liked songs?? Frustrating to skip through 100 songs straight to get back to random. Please fix. The "previous song" button should take you to the last song you actually listened to. If you "add to queue", play that song, then afterwards press "previous song", it will be like you never played the queued song. Very silly & unhelpful design in my opinion. At least put in settings.

About every ninety days, your subscription automatically goes up 15% with no heads up or warning. And they are constantly pumping ads! Playing the AI Playlist, DJ X, immediately crashes the app. New Spotify generated playlists aren't as good and rarely play new music anymore. Smart shuffle literally played sleep scapes in the middle of a workout playlist. Don't know what's going on but it's a lot worse than a couple years ago.

It's a really good app. I have had it for a few years now. My only complaint is sometimes when I am listening to a song and close out of the app then go back in there is a new trending song on there instead. Only happens every now and then though. Still recommend this over anything else.

great app, plenty of good music and it works just fine, one huge problem, it is made for premium users only. all albums and playlists are automatically shuffled and you can't unshuffle them without premium, something you can do for free on a computer. you get ads every two to three songs and not the 30 minute ad free listening they promise. besides that it is a perfectly good app and works fine

Unfortunately, Spotify has decided to make it so that free users can't select the song they want to listen to, and it's permanently set to Shuffle Mode to promote their Premium service through inconvenience. I've been a big supporter of this app, for the big reason being it helped me find new music. now it just plays anything I've ever liked at any point. if I do an EDM song radio, it'll shuffle in sweater weather.. the point being, the algorithm is killing my vibe, where it used to be the biggest reason I liked the company. didn't use to be this way. losing interest in paying for it at this point..

I used to like this app a lot, but ever since the latest update it's been awful Shuffle no longer works as it should. It plays the same songs over and over, doesn't matter how many times I skip them. Update after 4 months of continued issues: I pay for premium. Spotify is my go-to for music streaming! I love the vast library of songs, the personalized recommendations, and the ability to create custom playlists. What did you do? There have been a modicum of updates that have made interacting with your app easier. Shuffle Feature is Severely Faulty! I've had spotify premium for over a decade and have realized for the past few years that it'll repeat the same 20ish songs for a 10hr+ playlist. Anytime you try to listen to files it closes. Like, if you go to your files and click on an audio file, you'll be routed to Spotify for two or three seconds, and then Spotify closes. If you try opening local files it works just fine, but still. Other than that, the app's alright.

I have been using spotify since 2023, and listening to music on here has been a coping mechanism since then. Though, I'm disappointed that there is a limit to viewing lyrics, and picking songs. It's a nuisance, and the fact that they're preview videos that auto play boggles me because that's a drain on my data. I am giving this app 1 star for the following reason. Despite having ALL auto play settings turned off when my phone connects to my car radio this app starts to play. Despite not listening to it for days while listening to other streaming apps this app plays. Based on that I consider this app to be a predatory app that ignores the user's settings and preferences. I don't want to listen to this app all the time, but it doesn't care, it will automatically start as soon as it connects. UNINSTALL!

It will just change my playlist if I open the app and hit play too quickly? happens at least 2 times a day and has been a problem for at least 6 months. They moved the ai junk down where my liked songs should be. Even when you have a playlist downloaded, it needs to load the playlist before it can play it?

UPDATE 3/9/2025 So thankful to see the previous issue was fixed! I hope you all see this and can bring back the Playlist shortcut/widgets for homescreen. I LOVED this. 1/30/2024 I choose spotify over every other music app.but lately I'm super pissed about my playlist changing on its own.all of a sudden the first couple songs in play lists I created are differnt.And when I remove the song I didn't put there another one pops up.what the hell are yall doin?

Click a song takes ten yrs to load or it will end up playing a song that u didn't click on I pay for premium and it's still trash been clicking a song for the past ten minutes it still won't go through. Still pay for this app and it's still trash mad long to load my liked songs this app needs major fixing or I'm canceling this bs premium and going to SoundCloud already been making switches.

the app is a pile of hot garbage. It rarely works while driving, and still can't load a downloaded song, no matter how much signal you have. The service should be worth it in theory, but when the app is completely unreliable, it means you can't use the service when you want to

I honestly love spotify, I can listen to so many of my favorite song but one bad thing is that their are too many ads. I listen to one song then their is a ad then 1-2 songs later there is another ad. Overall I love how they have so much great song options and how you can make your own playlist with all your favorite songs !!

Used to like this app but overtime they kinda ruined everything the shuffle plays the same 10 songs over and over and if I don't wanna deal with that I have to buy their overpriced premium subscription that rivals Netflix for absurd pricing but at least Netflix has audio and video unlike this which just has audio so I just can't get behind a 12 dollar subscription. Also every now and then you'll get an ad that says you'll get 30 min of ad free music and it'll play 1 song before giving you an ad

The only reason I have for 4 stars and not 5, is having to pay for certain audio books. All because their "free" listening hours for premium accounts is rarely enough to get me through the books they let you use them on. Please just allow free listening hours for all books or just a certain number of free books per month (for premium accounts), PLEASE!!!

Easy to use. I love the "This is ______" playlists that show you the most played/popular songs of an artist. In turn giving you a chance to check out an artist or band you just heard of easily. If ya don't like their "This is..." playlist then it's safe to say you probably won't like much else of their music. Truly such a good way to expand your musical horizons.

My experience with Spotify on my mobile phone is mostly positive. The selection of music is varied, and I really enjoy the different genre Mixes and playlists it puts together. The app will occasionally freeze, but I'm not sure if it's a problem with the app itself or my phone.

I make a lot of playlists, but the app gets really slow very often. A lot of times if I search a playlist to add a song to, the whole app freezes and I have to get out of it. I have never had to close out and reopen an app so much. It shuts down randomly as well. It's just really frustrating

I really liked this app at first but after that 14 days of free premium ends, the font and screen display changes. It's almost like a whole new app. The songs don't play in order and I can only skip 3 times? Then why is Spotify trying to be TIKTOK? I'd like the old Spotify back.

I have an account for podcasts. Why can I no longer filter out played podcasts? Last week, the unplayed filter worked on every podcast. Now it doesn't. I went through the uninstall/reinstall process and re-set each podcast to filter out unplayed podcasts. When I opened them this morning, the filter was removed on all the podcasts.

Gives you 5 ads back to back after forcing you to watch an ad for commercial free listening, plays the same songs for artists on repeat instead of variance. Data tracking and personalized ads. Shuffle play for an artist's album isn't even the album, its a bunch of artists that you've probably never heard of but they assure you are relevant to who you actually wanted to listen to.

App is terrible. For what they charge per month one would think that you wouldn't have to jump through hoops to try and connect to your Google speakers. All the support troubleshooting is the same old worthless "clear the cache, reinstall, blah blah blah". Time to try YouTube Music. At least the app works.

There's no stations. Spotify's help section says you can go to any playlist and select a station option. However it looks like spotify removed the option. Thankfully, this was just a free trial. If you're thinking of jumping ship from another service, you're probably going to be disappointed.

I hate this app. It still defaults shuffle on a Playlist of songs I haven't heard. So I have no idea if I've listened to it because idk where I left off. It has a new Jam session. I get notifications to join other people's Jam session when I'm listening to my own music. No, go away. This is stupid.

It's really great. i just wish that they would put an option to organize your songs on your playlist cause personally, every time I add a song to my Playlist, I would have to delete it and add it back in the place I wanted it to be, so if you see my point I like to put the same songs together with the same vibe yk?

Too playlist based if you just want some random music from a genre. Algorithms don't seem really do well at guessing what I might like to listen to. Tried to use for podcasts since yt doesn't support the podcasts I like but the interface is awful and casting to speakers too glitchy to use. All in all an awful app for my use case.

Spotify is my ultimate go-to for music and podcasts! 💕 The personalized playlists are spot-on, and the sound quality is incredible. 🎵 Whether I need motivation, relaxation, or pure vibes, Spotify delivers every time. 🌟 It’s the perfect app for music lovers, with endless content to explore. Highly recommend! ❤️✨

I can't use the app. Why? Because it said playing ad before you listen to the songs (Free User Btw) but the problem is that the ad won't play or show it's just stuck on a black screen. I can search and try to play other songs but still the same problem occurs. I tried to close the app and re open it to see if it will work but still a nope. Please fix this bug.

It has barely functioned for so long now. Crazy what happens when you lay off 1500 employees! It takes forever to load when starting up, takes minutes long loading pauses between every song in at least one listening session a week. I've been listening to more audiobooks bc I can rely on those to actually play

Auto-plays when connected to a vehicle via BlueTooth - nifty, but no way to turn off. Couple that with the ever rising price for an degrading algorithm thag replayed a single songs from three or four artists on repeat to the point you actually forget the last time you've heard their 3rd most popular song? Yeahh, uninstalling and gonna see if Pandora has improved at all, I guess..

Not too big of a fan of songs being available to listen one day but gone the next. This app SUCKS at bluetooth connectivity. The Music Recommendations need A LOT of work as it doesn't really suggest music I would listen to. If I'm paying a subscription price - I'd expect the damn app to at least work properly. When connecting to Alexa App, Spotify isn't synced correctly. Artist emails suck as well. No chance in HELL to get anything artist exclusive. Welcome to Napster 2.0

it's mostly great, but it's been getting more expensive. the reason i bought a subscription was so i could listen chronologically to several broadway albums in one playlist, but recently my playlist no longer keeps the songs in chronological album order when ordered that way, thus effectively shuffling the songs anyways. if this doesn't get sorted (literally lol), i'm probably going to stop paying, as the chronology by song order per album was the only reason i went premium. please fix this!

New update is trash I can't play a song by clicking on it anymore causes the player to stop completely. The algorithm is one of the worst shuffle algorithms I've ever seen in the whole world. It plays all the same songs on the list over and over and over again and it won't play anything else that it hasn't played in the last like 30 days. It also will play the first song on the list and then that same first song will play again like four songs later. Worst shuffle ever.

This application consistently ranks among my top favorites across all my devices. Its extensive music selection, robust customization options, and seamless device integration fulfill all my requirements. I particularly appreciate the playlist recommendations generated based on my listening history. The AI-powered DJ functionality, which shuffles songs and intersperses recommendations, is also a significant strength. Well done, Spotify.

App no longer functions as intended. Can't delete playlists, can't get login code sent to email, constant crashing, customer service totally unresponsive (they don't do anything if you contact them so don't waste your time). I'm not paying for this garbage anymore. Ok, bye.

Very convenient for listening to both music and podcasts, but how come you don’t get the option to listen to songs unshuffled? Whereas if you were using tablet or desktop/laptop you get to pick whichever song you so desire and even play them on repeat, have the option to shuffle your playlist or have it play in order of your arrangement. I know it’s mostly got to do phones having the ability to be carried literally anywhere but c'mon.

Edited: This review used to be 1 star. I have been using Itunes for close to 12 years, yeah I know. However Apple lost my support slowly over the years as they do not care about the customer, only $$$. I got rid of everything Apple I had but I clung onto my Itunes. Then Apple pulled the last straw. They locked my account after I entered the password wrong 3 times and I was told it would take 1 week to unlock my account (without an Iphone). I switched to spotify and I will not go back.

The new update SUCKS! Queuing music was a pain before with misclicks being easy and plenty. Now, the queue can hardly be updated at all! You can't delete individual songs out of the queue, you can't select multiple songs, and the appearance is too minimalistic for me. Right now, this app sucks. A lot.

They kinda ruined Spotify, I can't choose what to start with on my playlist, I can only skip so much, and I can't re-order/que (I forgot how to spell it) my playlist. this is the free, non-premium version, so maybe it's different for people who want to pay 12$ a month for things I had before

UPDATE: Home page organization is improved. Notifications are not annoying anymore. LOVE the addition of audiobooks (more time would be nice)! Great selection! Superior to other paid music apps, but poor home pg experience...notifications are useless. There is no way to clear notifications for things without listening to them. I wish I could organize the home page in categories that I chose (playlists, podcasts, etc.) or at least eliminate things I don't want to see (suggestions, etc.).

Phenomenal app! I used it at home via my TV and my Bose speakers then continue in my car. Spotify is playing in the gym or on my walks or hikes. I can download my favorite playlist that I create on my own to play when i'm not online. But my favorite feature, currently, is my own personal DJ. And I can't forget to mention the end of the year playlists and greetings from artists! I think this streaming Music app is better than Pandora or SirusXM

Spotify has gone done hill since 2020! My music will pause for 3-5 seconds every couple of hours sometimes MULTIPLE times. My fiancee and I have a Duo account, and his DOESNT do it AT ALL! It is great if you want to listen to ads. I opened the app and started my playlist only to hear one song then four minutes of ads. It's an okay app. I do notice however when your listening to an ad that's supposed to give you 30 minutes of uninterrupted music after listening to it, it's not true one time it only played one song before going to another I have been paying for this subscription on and off for about 12 years. And the more Spotify ups its price the more the quality goes down. It's constantly crashing on me and interrupting my music. It doesn't even give me enough space to leave an honest review.

Free version sucks i feel like it should be like on other devices where it works good but that's just me and the fact that I have to wait an hour just to skip 6 songs Update: all i want is it to be like youtube music where they have everything unlocked but a few things locked not almost everything and they don't even care about free users cause all they care about is money not the experience this is just sad the only thing that works for free users are just podcasts and that's it

02/25 Shuffle is terrible. When listening to my main playlist, I can't remove songs in my shuffle playlist to make a quick song skip. The Equalizer is way too bothersome and difficult to find. I have to find the singular song that I don't want in my playlist anymore manually in a long list of songs. Yall mad trippin.

Without premium on mobile, you cannot change whether to shuffle or not. This means you can't choose which song you want to listen to. Also, you only get 6 skips per hour, so If you search up a song, play the Playlist because you can't just listen to the song, and try to skip ahead to the song you want to listen to, sometimes you get unlucky and you run out of skips before you make it to the actual song.

I love it. It comes on/goes off automatically when I get in and out, once paired to my vehicle. I pick my genre and it plays songs that are similar. If I don't like a song I press the minus on the right side of the screen and it goes to the next song. Great app...a lot better than when it first came out.

It has all the music I listen to. I also enjoy the option for listening to audiobooks. It costs way too much for premium though. Audiobook top-ups are ridiculously expensive too. I pay for Spotify, because I absolutely love listening to music. Otherwise, it is not a good deal.

Absolute garbage! How does an app that's been around for 15 years get worse and worse every update? I don't want to follow every artist to see their new releases pop up in my notifications. Give us new releases on the front page and actually update it every day. I shouldn't be finding out my #1 artist from last year put out new music 3 weeks after the fact. 🙄

On Samsung Galaxy a15 (android 14) can't be set to never sleeping app, all permissions have been granted as well as background data usage enabled, likewise unrestricted battery use. Every time I try to play a specific song in my likes, it won't play so then I have to click 10 songs above the specific one I wanna play and either swipe or skip until I finally reach the song I wanna play. Constant ads, even after watching an ad saying you'll get thirty minutes uninterrupted. Constant emails asking you to pay for spotify Premium and constant pop-ups in app doing the same. Pretty much useless to try and use it with Android auto. The app has been terrible for a long time but specially now. It doesn't Auto download podcast even when that option is checked. the app itself is not bad but when it comes to adding songs to my likes it takes a while to add and then my likes songs aren't all loading I know I have a lot of songs so it takes a min to load but it doesn't update with the genre or how many I had added if there anyway I can update to be a little faster or just without resetting my Spotify that will be great

Spotify is the best music 🎶 app ever made for Android, Apple, Samsung and every tablet and phone! I recommend that 👌 👍 you download it on your phone and tablet for free. The app has gotten better but the offline play is buggy and hard to get to. The UI for the main navigation areas needs to be consolidated somehow. I often get errors where I tap on a song and it was not respond but if I scroll down the liked songs playlist one further down will work.

App on android is light years behind the app on iPhone. I can only play certain songs on my liked Playlist, the bar that let's you see the songs in alphabetical order no longer works, I have to guess where I am. The app is awful on android. Update: Every update seems to kill this app.

Again, great application. However, it is so annoying but sometimes I get in my car and some random song by Kendrick Lamar we'll start playing once my phone attaches to the Bluetooth. Free version is completely broken, you can loop while on a console but not a phone, you can play songs back on console but not on mobile, you tap on a song you wanna listen to o and it plays every song out there but what song you actually wanna play... Premium is needed for optimal experience. It gives so many more things for you to use like the DJ, daylists, also ads, and more. I've used it for 4 years with premium and 10 overall. I've only had a problem with a recent issue where when connected to Bluetooth my app glitches and closes.

I'm gonna make this very short but this app is getting sucky day by day. Now I have to keep uninstalling and reinstalling the app cause when I go into Spotify first thing nothing will show up at all and it won't even load in but it will once you per usual uninstall and reinstall it'll finally show but that means I gotta redownload all my stupid songs and log back in again come on Spotify get real and it's so annoying.

Definitely best music streaming app, it worth a lot for us music love but arranging and rearranging music in library it's way too much. App developers should've add tools that allow us to rearrange our library display and then put all app interest recommendations music, artist and chart on the bottom. Overall wonder app whether it's free or premium. Lately I've upgraded to pro, it's worth having to subscribe for. I'll rate that soon.... Recommend music app.

I used to like this app. For reference, I'm a single dude. They've been plastering me with Ads for Duo and 'Family Spotify' and there's no turning that off. I PAY FOR PREMIUM AND THIS IS STILL HAPPENING. Today they asked for my address 'for tax purposes.' The have my zip code with payments, they shouldn't need that. It's pretty clear they're getting predatory. Already looking for a different service.

I've used Spotify for years, it was a five star app until lately... I have premium, one of the huge perks of premium was there were no adds... They still say you won't get adds with premium, but they put them everywhere in podcasts. Not the add reads by the podcast, but Spotify has put adds back in them, and to a hugely frustrating amount. It's not to the point I'll get rid of the app but this is BS.

Downgrading due to this annoying bug not getting fixed: almost always scrolls the playlist too far up when returning from now playing or the Android home screen. Should scroll to what's playing. Also could be enhanced by remembering where you are in each playlist when switching between them.

I hate the ads, like I hate them, I would like maybe 1 ad instead of 3-5 but if you have premium then my gosh I will not stop listening. Make it 50/50

I love this app but recently, about 3 months, the app has been glitching and taking forever to pause or play a song. The delay time when pressing a song is so frustratingly long that I want to throw my phone. I restart, shut off, and uninstall my phonel the app and nothing seems to fix it.

It's been said before but I'll say it again, the adds are OUTRAGEOUS. Seriously, I watch one add under the premise that I'll then have 30 min add free listening only to get through ONE SONG before I'm bombarded with 2 adds. Even the 5 star revews bring this issue up. Unexpectable, the features may be good but what's the point if everything is behind a pay wall. Only use this app for podcasts find a different one for music. #1 top free is a JOKE

Ad popups even on premium? please stop. 2021/03/02 Still getting ad popups in app. 2023/11/07 Still getting ads, now trying to get me to pay for two people instead of just me. 2025/03/23 Still the same behaviour, but now the app has opened itself overnight, so the first thing I see upon picking up my phone in the morning is a full screen, flashing, scrolling ad.

I find that with incrental updates on this app comes a clunkier, inconsistent and confusing user experience. I hate the extra step in removing liked songs from my library. Most recently the ability to drag the search bar to quickly scam through music by time has been removed making scrolling through a library of ~5k songs an inconvenience.

The new queue update actually took features away from us. There used to be a button so you could add songs to the queue that were already in the queue and that's gone now, you have to search for them individually to add them back to the queue now. The queue just got infinitely harder to use on mobile, you used to be able to select like 20 songs and readd them to your queue to play them again. I really hope this update is reverted to the original concept. Cannot remove songs individually in queue

I find it pointless to have "shuffle" and "play in order" to be behind premium. It should be basic interaction that should've been free. I understand the premium for downloading music, ad free, and listening offline; but having those two behind a paywall just sucks. Like, what do you mean I have to pay for something that's free on any other app? :(

App stability and usability keeps improving. Playlist creation and editing options are basic. Listening stats aren't available. "Live" playlists aren't possible. Customer support is rubbish: you have to trawl through forums. Good sound quality but no lossless or hi-def options, unlike ALL its competitors, a huge downside. Many gapless albums don't segue correctly, which makes them unlistenable to me. Spotify connect is great when it works, and it's widely available. Do better, Spotify.

Man, this sucks and probably the worst music app I've installed. The reason? When I play a song in my playlist, it will suddenly stop and I LITERALLY have to go back to Spotify to play it. And when I did, it went all the way to the start, now I have to play it again! It always happens when I open an app! I hate this! Please fix this, NOW! Ya'll gotta fix this immediately! I hate it when the song stops suddenly and it ruins my vibe!

Recent update caused error/bug with playback. When playing a music or a podcast, when skipping to certain part of the episode, then clicking on the Android button to show all running apps (bottom left or right of screen) and then selecting Spotify, the content pauses (sometimes stutters) and resumes from the original skip point, so if you initially skip to 20 minutes into the episode and let it play for 10 minutes, it should resume to 30 minutes but goes back to 20 minutes.

Good when it works, likes don't work half the time try clicking on the older songs I added and they don't play. Also... Spotify needs to notify it's users when a artists changes the music and what it was originally called so we can find the audio we actually liked. Too many changing the songs to something completely different ruining playlists you've made.

moved from another prominent app to this one. My queue will glitch with multiple of the same song, I'm talking 5-7 of the same in a row. It's been doing this for well over a week. Also BRING BACK THE HEART FOR LIKES PLEASE

Suddenly the queue gets deleted when I fully close the app? Since when? And adding songs to multiple playlist is a nice feature but it's messing with showing if I have a song liked and it's a nuisance having to click the add to playlist button to see if it's already liked instead of it already being visually there like up until recently.

Thinking of canceling my subscription because the app is increasingly becoming more and more unusable. I know others who already have for the same reasons. 1) Will not load anything. Everytime when I'm trying to skip a song it lags out so much. Just goes super slow. To the point which it ends up closing because it says it stopped responding. I'm on Android. I allowed my Premium subscription to lapse because I was unhappy that despite paying for Premium my New Episodes feed was full of paywalled content that I couldn't play or remove from the playlist. Spotify is getting deadly annoying now. After the first song. I've wanted a subscription for Spotify forever. I finally got the chance to get it and Im not losing it ever. I never did listen to pod cast before now but I now have six favorites. Join Spotify because it's well worth it. Their customer service people are stellar and will go above and beyond to make sure any glitches are resolved to your satisfaction! Special thanks to Mary Grace for all her help when I couldn't download my podcasts!

Love the awesome variety of music from newly released music to older harder to find music. Love how the app shows the lyrics and selects playlists based on music that I enjoy listening to. The offline option also makes listening without wifi a breeze. The price is also very reasonable considering I get access to hundreds of podcasts as well as ebooks and audiobooks. It's like a one stop shop for all of my listening needs. Highly recommend using this app for all your listening needs.

Spotify really needs to change their algorithm. They keep serving you the same songs day after day. And also every time I open tha app it takes a good 10 seconds until I can search for music,I don't know if it's because I use SD card as the storage for Spotify or it's just the app checking my subscription but it's really annoying.Good app though

Update - Really enjoying Spotify, seems more stable, audio books are a big plus. *Feature request* in android auto you cannot see the full title of the song playing. moving the stars again from 2 to 4 bcs everything so good so far. been more than a year since i became a premium user and no there's no regrets. i think the only issue i have is some of my downloaded albums won't play offline, which defeats the purpose of having offline mode in the first place (not sure if it'll be the same on different phone but hopefully not)

This is the best music streaming app hands down. Love the recommendations and the algorithm is amazing. I would give this 5 stars, however, there is a major problem I have encountered for now 2 months. Fix this Spotify. Your due for a new bug update anyhow

This app is really good BUT I HATEE how you cannot pick a specific song like you can on the pc version or even other mobile devices you can! Just not on the phone version and it's annoying. I want to listen to a specific song and instead I have to deal with the shuffle playlists they make.

1/3/23: Works as it's supposed to, except for shuffle, which only plays the same ~50 tracks over and over unless you clear data, which deletes your settings. 1/11/25 update: Lately, I've noticed it seems to use a different part of my playlist for shuffle each time I cycle through the shuffle modes. Maybe Spotify has fixed the shuffle mode? Will keep checking on this.

The only paid subscription application I have continued to perpetually maintain. It's versatile, and can be used in a multitude of ways. I use it across multiple devices with pretty seamless functionalities. For instance, the echo dot which is placed in my bathroom. "Alexa play Spotify" is a nice option when already in the shower. A Galaxy Tab mounted on my Dashboard with access to the internet via hotspot. Ghetto fancy fam.

Basically the origin of the "Wanna break from the ads?" meme, yes really funny i know. Indeed, it has so many ads you would just wanna listen to a looped song on Youtube (it doesn't put ads in-between, for now). It has a massive song and music library, but also podcasts and videos for the sake of the capitalistic economy. Premium is a scam at this point. Why even make this app famous in the first place?

To be honest, the app is amazing but there are a few improvements needed. First: Ads. There are too many, and I can't get premium. Second: The lag. It lags way too much once it took me 3 hours to play a 2:34 minute song. But overall the app is amazing.

It's a great music service and I have zero complaints besides some glitches, I just really hope the music artists are benefiting the way they should off of these streams. I'm sure everyone here who has this app loves music just as much as I do and it would be saddening to see these things crashing down in the future. Thank you🤍
