I love Spotify, but this app has bugs. It consistently struggles to connect to certain Bluetooth devices, like my car. YouTube music, WhatsApp etc have no issues. It will "pause" unsuspectedly, like play 13 seconds of a song then stop. It requires me to delete the whole app and reinstall. Pretty annoying considering the price just went up? I have restarted my app, installed/uninstalled etc. the issue is considtent. Are there any fixes for this?

Queue menu has been made less functional and useful for the sake of "sleek modern design". Useful features keep being removed for seemingly no reason (other than to impress easily impressed shareholders presumably). Genre selection at the top of playlists might as well be gone for how useless it is now. App constantly declines in quality over time. Other than that I like that I can listen to music on here, something I could do on a 1989 mp3 player. Veery Innovative.

Recent updates have ruined the experience for me. I listen to podcasts on my train commute, passing through weak/no network areas. Previously, Spotify would pre-buffer enough to keep playback smooth. But now, it stops instantly when the signal drops. I have a Premium account and can download episodes, but I don’t want to manually plan downloads every day just to avoid brief network issues. Please restore the old behavior of prioritizing user experience over data usage concerns.

Great range and I like the interface. The algorithm is the problem. It's gone from okay, to bad, to awful over the years. Now it's so poor that it puts the most obtuse and jarring songs in playlists and makes an effort to insert songs that you constantly skip with no rhyme or reason. It used to do a fairly good job of playing new music and matching vibes and genres. It's awful now. I spend a lot of time skipping and then an hour later, skipping the skipped song. Smart shuffle is trash too.

Could not fully and freely explore the app because the app is stopping me. I tried to create a playlist and I always ended up with the app putting songs in it instead of me. That effectively makes the playlist feature useless. Instead of me listening what I like the app is trying to tell me what to listen in hope that I may eventually hopefully like it... maybe. Shuffle is enforced on the free/demo acc. This was a horrible experience and I'm deleting my account and will not subscribe.

I use it constantly and have for years, however the current development team seems to have their heart set on making it unusable. It's looking like its time to jump ship. Every new feature is a worsening of functionality. Specifically the new queue format is just objectively worse than it used to be. You can no longer easily distinguish which songs are queued, and which are just next on the album/playlist. Additionally, you cant pause or skip from the queue screen. Pathetic software design.

Premium Subscriber. App is continuously lagging when I'm on plane mode or without connection. Impossible to play downloaded songs or podcasts. Just plain useless. I don't want the app to load unnecessary data. I jjst want music. Stop making this app data heavy. Just. Music. Please. I'm giving an extra month and will cancel after, so tired of wasting my money and walking with silent earbuds. Pathetic.

Beautiful app but the algorithm sucks. You pick an album to listen to and you start some redundant songs. I sincerely see no reason why I should be listening to one song multiple times in a single album selection. Similarly, when I pick an artist to listen to, I expect to hear songs from them alone or collabos they did. Instead, I get a mixed batch of the artist I chose and other strange, unrelated ones. Otherwise, the app is great with a wide range of audio and musical collections.

Great app, however some inconsistencies. The website version of Spotify allows you to skip songs for free, whilst the free version of Spotify as an app for mobile devices don't allow you to, requiring you to purchase a subscription to Premium to skip songs. Yes there's other benefits to premium, I'm not leaving that out. 10/10 on how ads get delivered, not like how YouTube would deliver theirs.

I use Spotify with my alarm. Lately when I turn the alarm off at the notification bar, the song continues to play in Spotify which is very frustrating. Was in the shower when it went off, so I turned it off but then had to open Spotify (phone is wet now, floor is wet) and I'm faced with a question. Did you go to the Stereo MC's concert? What? I never registered any interest. I just want to turn off the song. This has been happening for a few weeks now.

Tons of loud and annoying ad, recommendations are biased. Can you imagine listening to hair metal and then getting a song with moaning Arab? Can not listen to single album, it keeps switching to others or back to biased recommendations. This app does everything it could to annoy its users unless subscription is bought, but I keep seeing it does not solves the issues. Ad is wasting more mobile traffic than music because it is video. I find myself using mp3 more often like in good old days.

Where to begin , first off the quality of service has gone down and the price keeps on rising. The recommendation algorithm has really gone down hill was once really great did a great job of recommending new music suitable to my tastes , now it just does not even try. The ui is not intuitive leaving the user to search in awkward places to find functionality as well as overall bad layouts. That is just the start unfortunately for the character limit of this review I need to keep it short

Since recently, the Jam session is full of bugs and the user experience is really frustrating. As a jam guest, after 10 seconds or when a new song is added to the playlist the current song restart from the top. And since the guest is not sync with the host the song stops way before the end. Edit : It recently improved, but there are still some cuts when adding a new song Edit : on 21.01.2025 it's finally fixed ! Thank you :)

Spotify is getting more pay-to-win, slowly removing or limiting the use of the features that used to be free, just to make people buy their premium subscription. I don't mind the damn ads but not able to choose the next song is insane. It's even better to download songs by mp3 and make your own playlist. I hope you get better Spotify👎

The recent update has made the app frustrating to use. Every time I open my liked songs, only 50ish songs load. I have to restart the app just to load all the songs. Then if I'm listening to a song and turn of my phone screen, it resets the song list back to the top of the list and again only loads about 50 songs. God forbid you open the lyrics, it does the same thing again! Not to mention the random lagging and crashing! Seriously, what's going on?

When I get TEN 30+ second ads in a row between every 5 songs, it doesn't make me want to pay for your premium service. Update: I ended up switching to YouTube Music. Spotify is no longer worth the time. I'd recommend everyone to stop financially supporting a company that keeps paywalling basic features and increasing their prices every year (for zero improvements.) There's plenty of music apps out there that don't take advantage of their userbase.

It is unbelievable how badly optimised the app on Android is. Instead of adding unnecessary features like video feeds, more badly curated stuff and such, try making the app waaaay more stable. I advise anyone to just move to YT Music if you are already on Android. Even on low-end hardware it works flawlessly. I have been subscribed to Spotify since 2015 and I now switched over. Fix your s***. Also allow Spotify Lite in other regions if you suck at optimisation.

This app needs premium so bad like I can't even play a song of my choice!! U need to improve this. Atleast keep a limit of songs upto which we can play. After that limit, u need to purchase the premium. Its becoming a very bad app. Didn't expect this from Spotify. It was such a nice app and suddenly this happens... JUST FOR MONEY! This needs to be fixed or else, its creating a problem!! We people always want to listen to the songs of our own choice and we can't... thats very difficult. Fix this.

I've been facing an issue where the app shows the song is playing, but there's no sound. This has happened multiple times, and it's frustrating. I've tried everything—reinstalling the app, clearing the cache, and even restarting my phone—but the problem still persists. It ruins the listening experience, especially when you're in the mood for music. I hope the developers address this issue soon.

Great app, a lot of songs. But, if u stay free to play, it's copeium. U get an ad roughly every 15 minutes, and you can't skip many songs. Ontop of that, if u wanna sample a song, like u found one, searched it on Spotify, and clicked on it. You'd be met with about 2 minutes of ads. SO, it's all fun and games, until u stop playing.

update: hi, i have the newest version of the app and it is still happening, something literally with every single song, it's super annoying and irritating. --- There is this glitch that is driving me nuts. every time i have spotify open and play music or pdocast, everything is okay, the moment i go to different app or home screen, the music stops for no reason... its beyond annoying

If I leave the Spotify app running in the background it switches devices seemingly at random. For example if I'm listening in my car or on my PC it'll abruptly switch to my phone. There are also frequent issues with smart shuffle turning on by itself/playing songs in the same order, and there's still no way to default the Library tab to your custom order.

Great app and everything, however, there's this new glitch happening where everytime I try to share lyrics on Instagram using my Fold 5, the story comes out all wonky and has a weird aspect ratio, I guess? Please fix it whenever you can. Also, it would be nice to have a song detection feature instead of needing to Shazam everything. Other music apps the feature, I see no reason as to why Spotify shouldn't have it.

Terrible experience. They don't let you change the songs and play random songs. You can't select the song you want to listen. They say ad free music for 30 minutes but then there are 3 more ads after every 10 mins. They are forcing their premium on you. If you don't have premium you can't even listen to a single song of your choice. Spotify once was the best platform for music but now it lost its essence. Switching to another app. Very disappointed. Would have rated 0 if had the option. Horrible

App is terrible now. Favourite artists is completely wrong, previously had an artist I haven't listened to for about a year and now shows one I've NEVER listened to or heard of. The AI Spotify uses to sort genres and generate playlists is abysmal. It can't distinguish between majorly different genres and will suggest the same songs over and over, both in song radio and Spotify mixes. It's a joke really. The app just gets worse and worse. I pay for premium and still have a terrible experience.

It's great for listening and I can find everything easily. However, the adverts just PMO. I know that's what comes with Spotify free, but there's way too many, I click on a song, and I get 7 adverts, one song, and then another 7 adverts. This really needs to be sorted, 7 30-second adverts for just a 2 minute song is ridiculous

Good selection of artists, with whole whopping discographies, wherever affordable. I miss some songs which are not available and the mixed playlists don't do much for me whenever that odd, unheard not-so-good song comes up. But at least the sound quality is good. I can only recommend Spotify to anyone despite the flaws algorhithm or song choice wise.

Impossible to switch subscription. Trying to get duo and the prompts keep telling me to open the app on my phone... I'm doing this through my phone! Tried through the app and through their website. Any walkthrough tells me to go to account and select manage plans, I don't get that option. Closest I can get is manage subscription then it tells me to do it through my phone as stated earlier. Confused and frustrated.

The queue UI was the thing stopping me from moving to Apple Music. I found convenient the ability to edit and add multiple songs at a time. Now it's another drag and drop, more tedious and time consuming. I think I'm gonna move to apple or tidal, that have the same horrendous system, but at least have high quality tracks. At least add an option to change the ui to legacy...

The app worked great at first but after a month it became incredibly slow and laggy even with the best internet. Reinstalling the app and clearing the cache doesn't work. For some reason simply pausing and playing the music is tied to internet connection so if you've got slower internet or the same issue as me the music will pause, play, and change when it feels like it. Not when you want it to.

The app is awesome. It have each and every song in it. The only problem is the premium pack. If u use the normal pack, u can't experience every feature in it. I am not recommending the developers to remove the premium pack but always recommending them to add some features in the normal pack too. It seems like the app is forcing it's users to use the premium pack which would be hated by many one.

The app has way too many irritating ads that disrupt the listening experience. Also, sometimes you’re not even able to choose the songs you want to listen to, which makes it really frustrating. It could be much better with fewer ads and more control over song selection.You often can't choose the songs you want to listen to, and there's no option to shuffle playlists. On top of that, most song lyrics are unavailable, which takes away from the overall enjoyment.

I love this app, with premium its almost perfect, however i HATE the new feature that takes the original songs from the radio/mix playlist thats made by spotify. At LEAST add the song back. Because when i try to look up this specific song the only thing that shows up is the radio of the song, and the damn song isnt even in there. Its extremely infuriating. Please add it back.

The new queue features are horrible. Now you have to swipe to get rid of a song individualy instead of just selecting all the ones you don't want and deleting them as a group. Then you have to swipe five times just to delete one song off the queue because it doesn't register and when you do get rid of a song it's name just overlaps the next song's name so it's hard to read. If it's not broken don't fix it, the way songs used to queue was good and now it's made using the app unbearable.

I have used this app for years and have loved it, but now i find podcasts are a nightmare ads all the time and I pay for premium, why?? and all the locked content that fills up your podcadt feed with no way of getting rid of it, I preferred the old format. And why do I get random songs that I have not chosen pop into my playlist. I had thought that it's my Playlist my song choice.

I've been enjoying Spotify for several years, I started subscribing to premium no ads about 4 years ago and haven't looked back. I love that you can use one membership for the whole family. I have created several playlists, which you have the option to make public or keep private. I enjoy the daily mixes created just for me, too. I've also listened to a few podcasts once they were available on the platform. I highly recommend Spotify as a music listening app.

I'm almost at the end of my free trial (I will DEFINITELY be sticking with it when runs out). The amount of music available is actually INSANE!! I can't get over the amount of songs that are available. I've discovered music from the late 90's & early 00's that I'd forgotten about I feel like a teenager again. No complaints whatsoever I love the app it's easy to navigate & use.

Why am I paying a premium subscription only to have it buffer every 20 seconds, takes 2-5 minutes to change the song, crashes randomly when listening to music, resets my playlist front the very beginning when I press the shuffle off instead of just playing where I left off, the app freezes in between changing songs and I have to wait at least 2-3 minutes before I can press the next button and a whole load of other problems??? This is a brand new phone with 256GB of RAM so obviously it's not me

I'm not sure why, in this day and age, this app doesn't have a safe feature in the filter. Every time I start the app, I have to select unplayed, or it will play episodes I've heard already. To make things worse, the filter doesn't work 90% of the time. So I have to drag the play bar to the end of the episode so it will skip to the next episode. But then, of course, it usually plays another one I've heard. It's very frustrating.

This app was so good in the start but now the heck is wrong with it!!! You can't listen to song from search box. You can't skip songs more than 6 times . You can't play songs from your own playlist and other so many problems. It seems like the pride of being famous app has taken over this app and now it's getting so greedy. It sometimes feel like if they're begging to u to take premium. Other famous apps also asks us for taking premium but not in the way soptify is doing. I am badly disappointed

Even though I like the service and the app as a whole, it has one huge drawback that make me want to resign from subscription - shuffle just sucks. It is so bad, that just for this one feature alone I am giving 2 stars. Basically, no matter what you do, you hear same songs over and over again. It is worth mentioning, it is not only my observation, just google to see how many people are affected. Please do something about that, because in current state this is deal-breaker.

I loved using my Spotify premium for audiobooks until they changed what was included in the subscription. I used to be able to purchase audiobooks so I could listen to them all in one shot. Now, the premium subscription includes 15 hours of listening time, and I'm no longer able to purchase audiobooks. So unless I want to pay an additional amount for an extra 10 hours of listening time, I need to wait until my subscription renews each month to continue listening to the audiobook. Very upsetting.

For some reason, Spotify reworked their "upcoming songs" feature, and I now can't remove songs from the upcoming list - I can only drag them around. And I can't drag songs into the queue area anymore to preserve an order if I decide to shuffle but want to keep a few songs in a certain order. Baffling why they would remove such good functionality and replace it with something that is so restrictive and terrible. I'm incredibly unhappy with the change

The amount of ads given after a single track is insane. This company started their service off of illegal downloads and will do everything to block unlocked apks of spotify, very hypocritical. Let alone when you have the premium service, I had it for a few years and it was horrible. Constant crashing trying to open liked songs and that's even if you can get into the app. It constantly breaks trying to open (I cleared cache and reinstalled) it's just in a pathetic state due to corporate greed.

Spotify's recent updates have made the experience unbearable. Forced shuffle, autoplay, and other premium features locked behind a paywall are making it impossible to enjoy the app the way I used to. It’s frustrating that basic controls are being taken away, and it feels like they are only interested in pushing users towards paying for Premium. Music is a lifeline for many of us, and these changes make it harder to enjoy. I’m seriously considering switching to another platform.

this is not a good music app. it does the job, but has weird bugs that don't get resolved. the layout is 'responsive' but doesn't allow for any real changes to the layout. i have had issues with podcast not loading (even though the ads will load just fine (yes, there are adds on the paid version of the app))

this is a good app for when you need some music why did i give it 2 stars?, well, it is because of a few issues that I believe is not limited to me .1) when I click on a song when playing another , it will preview the song instead of playing it completely. 2) it will play random songs when I try to play something that's on my playlist,it will play a random song , and there is no way to stop it.3) I can't reliably switch and block songs. I have a few more issues but I'm outta space so bye!

It's a great app, but there's not enough free will, in my opinion. Meaning, I don't get to choose what I listen to. The app decides what I want to listen to. I'd appreciate it if the Premium prices would be lowered or if the app is changed to let users have more free choices to pick from. It's really irritating if I listen to something peaceful, and the next song is heavy metal. The other problem is that there are songs that are interrupting my ads. FYI, that's sarcasm.

While Spotify offers a fantastic music collection and smooth functionality, the free version is incredibly restrictive. Basic features like choosing specific songs or freely skipping tracks in a playlist are entirely locked. It feels like users of the free plan are forced into a frustrating experience, which really takes away from the joy of using the app. Definitely needs improvement!

I hope you understand that "listening to a song of your choice in any order" isn't supposed to be a privilege, but a necessity. The apps sincerely let me down after the recent changes, as if they're pushing you towards premium simply for wanting to listen to your music, and the constant ads and the limit on skips make this so much worse. The option to queue songs and loop songs have also been removed, as well as the freedom to skip to a favorite part of your song, Id rather switch streaming apps

The app can be buggy at times. One thing I hate most is when songs get randomly deleted from my created playlists. I started noticing that some songs that I added few days ago would then disappear. It's very annoying especially that I've paid for streaming services. Some albums that I downloaded also don't have their cover art displayed. Sometimes the dates displayed were also incorrect.

One of the worst free app experiences you can get on mobile I get the ads. But the fact that you can only hear on shuffle and only skip 6 songs per hour is ridiculous. Even if you are playing a created playlist, it starts playing suggestions that aren't in said playlist. The free works as it should on the computer, but the mobile version is unbearable

I don't uderstand what is the purpose of the app. Every single possible funktion of the app is paid and there are bizarre "bugs" like if you go on the window of the song, click play and a random song from the author starts to play instead. Like, why? Please don't blame me if I understood something wrong, that's only a very first impression.

"Hey we saw you skipped 3 songs, it's time for your mandatory 3 ads, oh and we're not letting you skip anymore songs. What's that you want to listen to a specific song, how about a preview and if you get lucky maybe it'll pass by on shuffle. By the way do you want to check out these playlistz that in no way fit your taste in music?" -The free user experience trying to find new music.

"We're always making changes..." yes, and that's about it. No actual improvements. The new queue design is absurd. It doesn't add any new features, it actually takes them away and makes the queue look like another dumbed down UI change, on par with all those you've been rolling out for the last 4 years or so. Don't "fix" what ain't broken. Uninstslling this version, installing the older one, and disabling the updates. I'm seriously thinking about moving to another service.

I love Spotify. It is my one and only app I use to listen to music. Spotify is something I can't live without but one thing that tickles my pickle in a bad way is the fact that I can't fast forward my songs, when they removed that feature it really bother me. It's not a big deal now, but what is a big deal is the fact I can't pick songs freely anymore, like I need to wait 6 hours???? Spotify what even is this feature, it doesn't tickle my pickle in a good way 😤

spotify used to be great as used to believe you get what you pay for..... after the new update the mobile app has become complete trash!!! its lagging as hell, it crashes which it never used too!!! the layout and artist selection is absolute shite. i mean theres no scroll wheel to cut to quickly navigate to the artist you want, whats also going on with the sorting system can it no longer sort the artist alphabetically even tho its selected? all in all why change something that wasnt broken! 😡

I have moved from another app to Spotify, but I'm giving 3 stars because i was shocked to find out that the search song by audio doesn't exist on Spotify. This was really important for me, and I couldn't have thought to check before moving to Spotify as Spotify it's this huge app. YouTube has it, Deezer has it and so on. Spotify, please tell me you will have this ASAP 🙏🏼 I don't want to move back to my previous app because of this.

Nearly a year and still not fixed. If you turn on the smart shuffle feature, it will constantly shuffle the same songs. I have over 700 liked songs, but you'd think I have about 30. I've tried reinstalling and clearing the cache, even had a new phone and still the same problem. Also when listening to podcasts you are bombarded by pop-up ads. Not good when paying for premium

Good interface and easy to use. My only issue is that despite having an offline mode it often gets stuck trying to use data and can take a while to recognise that you are offline. It would be nice for there to be a toggle for offline so that it's seamless to switch. I say this as I travel a lot for work and it can be frustrating having to wait for Spotify to eventually switch over to allow you to use offline content as it tries to load the whole app and all it's content first

Eww! Such a disgusting app! Not only does it not play the song you choose, but also it ensures to play songs instead that are diametrically opposite to the kind of songs you're trying to listen to. An advertisement pops up after every song that freezes the screen for an eternity. It has become more of a spam app which messes with your device and your mind.

The app is good-ish. One bug that I think you've ignored enough is the issue related to when someone decides to use SD card storage. If accidentally or purposely, the phone restarts or switches off, we tend to lose every goddamn piece of information we had stored, and all the offline content simply vanishes so we have to redownload the podcasts and playlists. It's become an inconvenience especially since the reason someone downloads content it's because they want to listen to it offline😭

Spotify is far, far too painful to use for commuting. It struggles with fluctuating internet connections (eg on the subway). App becomes unresponsive even when accessing downloaded content, as Spotify attempts to sync or load online features unnecessarily. Switching to offline mode can help, but this requires constant manual intervention. PLEASE SORT THIS OUT, SPOTIFY!

Not sure why, but I can not play albums while in android auto. If I select it from auto, the auto says there is no items. Open Spotify on phone and it plays through auto shows nothing on auto display. Fine with play lists. Also I am listening to a song get out the car get in and it's gone from Spotify. P.s. I use offline unless I'm in house due to data use restrictions. What is with all the remastered songs? Give me the original.

I finally budged and got Spotify Premium (on student discount luckily), and I have to say it's how you would expect a music streaming service should work. But then I used the free version on my friend's phone and it's absolutely unusable. You can't change your music after a couple of changes? And the numerous ads are still there. I used to find it a bit of bother back then, but now it's unfathomable.

I'm paying for premium, i'm still a student and just because it's been 4 years, i'm paying the high price even though i can't really... also premium but for what? you can't even add a song to a playlist if it already contains it once! (it supposedly working on computer but doesn't for me) Everything is more complicated and less intuitive than before! You're even paying more for less! Take back the humans behind all the good things (real shuffle, wrapped, song suggestions etc) and ditch the ai!

Using this app on my Pixel has been a nightmare. I'm constantly uninstalling the app, downloading again to get it to work. If I choose a genre to play on my liked list, I can never get it to play all genres on the liked list again and have to delete the app to get it working again. Using Smart shuffle it just plays the one genre even though I've selected my full list. Frustrates me to no end that this has been happening for a year and not rectified even though I've reported it multiple times.

The new spotify update to the queue on mobile is so much more restricting I feel so disappointed 😭 again prioritizing aesthetics over functionality. You now swipe left and right to add and delete songs meaning you can no longer mass select to add and delete songs to your queue. This makes me much less likely to use spotify because I queue up a lot of music

Hard work. Glitchy. Tries to switch devices during play, pauses whilst trying, disconnects from WiFi Hifi devices to ask if you want to continue playing, then switches to phone, randomly mutes whilst playing. Unable to turn off automatic switching between devices. Even though it's just my phone and Hi-Fi. Pretty frustrating. Tried suggested fixes. Deleted cache, reinstalled re Help. Forum's suggestions out of date, fix settings unavailable on Android 15. Using a Pixel 7. Will not renew Premium.

Spotify is not like the older Times. It has got so many improvements and has degraded too much, I would have rated 5 stars because it is a very good app for hearing music and vibing:) but because it has so many problems I will only rate it 2 stars. Today I wanted to listen to a song, after playing one time I got two ads that doesn't stop. Also where are the lyrics..? For any songs on spotify on older Times it has the perfect lyrics for every songs. Now it is telling me that couldn't load lyrics*

Spotify has been great but now has developed some bugs that has made the experience not-so-fun for me. I listen to most of the albums/playlists offline which means I download them, and recently, I noticed that after I've downloaded them, they're not actually downloaded yet, so I can't play offline, I now have to download a second time, wasting data. That's bad!

Liked songs don't load past "A". I have more than two thousand liked songs and I normally just pick one and let shuffle do its work. However, since yesterday I can't seem to be able to scroll past the letter A. The scroll bar is obnoxiously big and it only show me about a hundred songs, so now I'm limited to those songs and the playlists suggested/saved for me. Is this an update bug or something? Please fix it, it's terribly annoying.

I've been using this app for many years: it's great for listening to niche music that you'd never hear on the radio. I don't mind that they have ads, and they have every right to advertise their own ad service, because how else would we know how easy it is to create a Spotify ad, or that it's free - see? You're not talking on mute! But when every adbreak has 4 ads in a row for their ad service... It's embarrassing! Will someone PLEASE buy advertising space?!

I tried so long to tolerate the free version of the app, but now it's just unbearable. Very basic features are unavailable. And the subscription prices are extremely on the higher end. At least for Indian users. If you want to be a money-sucking machine, don't even keep the app for free, as it is totally useless. Start services like Netflix where you can only access the app after paying. Stop this facade. Extremely disappointed.

The app was working well at first... Until I couldn't access it. It instantly logged me out and each time I try to log back in, it just writes "something went wrong" with no explanation. I sent an email to Spotify but still no response. Hello, I did what you asked but nothing works. Each time I try to log in, it just keeps writing, "something went wrong" please fix that.

I'm using the free version and it plays an ad and says enjoy 30 minutes of commercial free music, but then 2 songs later there are ads. Had 3 groups of ads in the ad free 30 minutes. Pretty pathetic and this level of lies is why I won't pay for a subscription. I did watch the full video and I wasn't near my phone so I definitely did not click the no thanks button. And the last 6 ad breaks have all been within 30 minutes.

I don't know why they put a limit on the number of songs you play in a day. Also, the ads are really irrelevant and irritating. The ad plays and Says "enjoy the next 30 minutes of uninterrupted listening," then a song plays, and then boom, a new ad plays. This app needs to get its bugs fixed. Otherwise, it won't work out. On this app, you won't hear music. All you'll hear is non-stop ads. If someone wants to destroy their day, just listen to Spotify free version.

Absolutely hate the recommended for you feature. If I wanted to listen to music I don't like I'd have it in my play list. If it's NOT on my playlist then clearly there's a reason for that. I'm not interested in finding new bands, I'd like to listen to the ones I do actually like. App is useless if I can't do the most basic thing it's designed for.

I'm not going to be complaining about ads but I think it's awful that I can't even choose a song on my own accord unless I pray for premium, that's just straight up awful. The app may lag for some people but not for me but I can't even listen to songs offline and there isn't a download option for them unless I'm downloading episodes. This needs to change. I came back to edit so I just want to say that at least remove smart shuffle, it's really unnecessary tbh. Super.

An alright music app, easy to find songs and playlists/folders makes ordering/categorising easy. Only issue is that its quite buggy. Currently I can't save playlist names they just show up blank and won't save when I change them. Can't add images to playlists either for seemingly no reason. Have looked everywhere for solutions and come up with nothing :/

When I first got the app, I was using it almost every week. It was a 5 star app, and then it slowly started getting worser and worser, because the ads have taken over, and every 2 songs, it asks me to get premium. Because of how the ad is played every 2 songs, it breaks the vibe of the music that I was listening to, which causes me to use the app maybe once every few months. Recommendation: Make ads appear less.

Very good app, changed music forever caused people to rely more on old catalogues than discover new music the ads get more obnoxious but there is premium thankful it exists wistful for the time when we would get new music on the radio each week and album releases were more impactful. Con: When you are listening to a playlist and add something to play after the list ends it will add it after the immediate song instead then go to suggested plays cutting off the playlist.

Edit: January 2025 since two updates ago it is stuck on shuffle during a podcast. Disabling shuffle should not be a premium feature of that is what's going on. Please give all users ability to select content types not to recommend/advertise to them. I wish that as a free user I could remove content from the your shows section. Sometimes I try something new and don't like it, and don't want it influencing what the app shows me later on.

So at the sart it was good, I could listen to the music I liked and got 6 skips per hour without getting premium but then it started to get annoying as it wouldn't let me skip anymore so I was stuck with a song that I didn't like or that I didn't know .I could just go to another app to listen to music for free. I know that apps want you to buy it so that they can earn money but what if you don't have the money to spend on things that make you small pleasures?Like music, everyone loves it.......

Keeps turning off. Sometimes runs for an hour, sometimes 15 minutes, other times one track. Then, I have to open the app again. Pretty frustrating. Also, why can't I decide what content I see, I want to set the genres I see, not interested in what YOU push or suggest, which is usually nothing like what I would like to hear. I also have no interest in podcasts, but I constantly get them pushed at me. Might be time to try Apple or Deezer

Yes I'm using the free version but recently there's been a change so a song is played when one podcast ends and before the next one begins. I occasionally listen to music on Spotify, very occasionally, but Spotify doesn't use this information to choose a song to play. No, it plays some horrendous song I'd never choose.

Poor experience. Very buggy. Offline mode is bad. What's the point of paying for family premium and downloading my songs and podcast episodes to be told you don't have connection. Very annoying whilst travelling on the underground for example. Update Jan 2025: Offline still an issue and can the downloads section go back to what it was before because I don't need to see the full podcast episode list just to scroll back up to the top of the list.

Honestly, I've been using Spotify for a while now and it honestly has been pretty nice, until I can even rewind songs, play the songs in MY playlist and can't even play the songs in a loop, like a short song. I'd honestly just use YouTube, but it doesn't play in the background. Spotify, please, stop hiding the necessary features behind a stupid paywall. Some of these features are straight up unethical, basically saying "You gotta pay money to use this app properly" . As a teen, music helps me.

unusable without premium, shuffling big playlists only plays a select few songs rather than actually shuffling them all, jam feature is extremely broken, if you get premium, "downloaded" songs only work when youre online so its a scam. SO SLOW!!!!! constantly crashes (its not an issue with my device, happens to many people i know too) and they keep raising the premium price. terrible but there really is no alternative as others like amazon music are somehow even worse.

The Spotify app gets worse and worse as the years roll by... The queue function is absolute gargabe on Android as of a recent update. Clicking play on a song in a playlist will play the one song and then revert to whatever was in the queue previously e.g. a podcast. There's also no clear way to clear the queue. Infuriating user experience. Oh and the app loads for an eternity, if ever, when offline despite knowing it's offline

Working fine then it just stops connecting to the internet. Internet is fine, cache cleared (in app and on phone) restarted phone. Uninstalled... Reinstalled... Now I can't even log in (WiFi is active and is fine) If you regularly go into bad service this app is practically useless.. UI is frustrating as buttons keep moving with a split second lag when you change pages, because it's trying to be helpful I guess? Also pay your artists more and fix the damn shuffle...

As a user, it is simply amazing. The recommendations are so good. I can not tell you how many amazing songs spotify recommended me. As a music fan from iran in general, it was way too hard to find new music and artists because of the way my country is. Spotify has been a blessing for me. I only wish they would treat artists better.

Never had a problem till recently. Every time I enter my library, all my liked songs don't load properly, and when I try to play the majority of songs (in said playlist), they don't play, unless I skip to it from a song I can play. I'm assuming this is an update issue. Can this please be fixed? Deleting the app, reinstalling it, and having to re-download 5,000+ songs will be a nightmare and time-consuming. Really considering going back to pirating music for free

can't even play the songs I want to listen to without premium now! And my skips are limited to 6 skips?! Why don't you guys just make it a subscription service?! Instead of putting every basic feature behind a paywall? Or are you guys getting a kick out of this, eh? Don't bother downloading this app. It's almost unusable and it's a waste of space and time now.

Was good until 2024, back in 2023 it would actually give you thr 30 minutes of uninterrupted listening it promised, now it has just become an ad trap which gives you more like 1 song of uninterrupted listening along with 4 30-second unskippable ads right after the song. Along with the crazy amount of ads, no matter what feedback you give about the ad, the same freaking one will still show. It isn't all bad though, the variety of songs is great, and you can listen without being on the app no prem

I’ve been using Spotify Premium for a while, and my friend and I have been trying to use the Spotify Jam feature to listen together. However, whenever I start a Jam and share the link, my friend is redirected to the home screen of the Spotify app instead of joining the session. We’re both using Android phones, and it’s incredibly frustrating that a feature like this doesn’t work properly. The app is great for music, but the Jam feature is a complete letdown. Very disappointed!

HORRIBLE app. Every time i try to put on a song (eg, Vampire) it gives me 2 minute long ads, and then, for SOME UNKNOWN REASON, it leaves me with the WRONG SONG. Honestly, Spotify! You had ONE job! And you cant even do that right! Like, if i click on ,lets say, 'Traitor', it gives me 'Get him back'!!!! Like, how can you put on a song i didnt click on!!! So dumb!!! I do NOT recommend this app.

This app literally sucks. They made almost everything require premium, lyrics, high quality audios, song order and try to go back to the recent song i listened to without searching it literally needs premium. every 2-3 songs adds popup. at this point just make the app cost money to download. not everyone can afford premium. its very annoying listening to a song then minutes later an add pops up, not 1 but 2 adds. this app got so annoying and boring. can anyone suggest me a music streaming app

Love the quality, but there are some bugs( For example, sometimes it switches the device randomly, and in all the multi-device thing has some areas to work on. Also on the mobile recently I have a bug with the playhead, when it stops on the beginning of the track, and I can unbug it only moving it manually, so this is an issue. In general I love the quality of audio and compatibility. But also definitely you need to do something with the shuffle, so that it doesn't throw you the same tracks)

It's a really terrible app that just doesn't work. Update: reinstalling didn't work and have tried everything that can be tried. Simular problems occur my tablet (samsung also) as well... even the offline version is paaaaiinfully slow on both devices so clearly its a problem with Spotify and not the fault of my phone. It's been on going for years and spotify hasn't done anything to sort out the issues.

Spotify had been my on and off app for listening to music. Only writing a review after the newest update changed the scrolling feature to a bar which is tiny by the way. Also when you scroll down to a song you want to play in a playlist, go out of the app and then return to said playlist, it changes positions to a place near the top.

It's good . I'm on the student offering so pricing isn't a problem . I'd appreciate if we can have a " start radio " option straight from a song like on YouTube music . I don't like having to Go to a song radio/playlist. I just want the radio to start instantaneously so. I'd also appreciate it if we had songs we can one click to start a radio on our home page ...just like on Yt music. Comments under each song also wouldn't be too much to ask for 😁

"Smarter Shuffle": Before I start, smart shuffle isn't a bad feature. Now that is out of the way, time to critique, the reason for my review is because of Spotify's insistance on this feature, for one, anyone like me who has the free version, this is Spotify's way of telling you to pay for it as by default every play is set to smart shuffle and you can't change it, making the whole Playlist function useless now. I understand it's need, but it shouldn't be the default, hence my critique.

I give 5 stars because if I had to suggest improvements, nothing comes to mind right away. The new Daylist feature was a great improvement, it offers wide variety in songs and artists but still to my taste. I don't share music with other users, but jumping between my devices (phones, car, laptop) goes smoothly. I have premium plan so there are no ads.

Adding useless updates like leting people play songs at limit. If we want to change the songwe can't change it cuz to limit has been reached. They are only thinking for premium users. What about the non premium user's. First i used to live this aap cuz the app was giving best using experience but now they it's not so. Really really disappointed. Please fix this or else I'm leaving this platform.

Very mediocre in terms of advertising and it is just incredibly annoying only having 6 skips per hour whilst adding songs that you don't want, it would be five stars if not for this, and smart shuffle playing a song I hate 50 times but the song I love once. I also don't understand why premium has to be so expensive when it doesn't work half the time.

Perfect! I do have the paid-for version because it has everything I want in a music app and I love it. Podcasts are great, audio books, really useful search function that actually works... It has everything. The amount of different music I've found just from recommendations is amazing. I've never had any problems using Spotify so I'll just keep on with my subscription and enjoy my listening. It makes me happy!

Spotify’s free version is almost unusable. You can only skip six songs per hour unless you pay, which is frustrating. On top of that, ads play every two or three songs, completely ruining the experience. It feels like they’re forcing users to subscribe rather than offering a decent free service. I used to love this app, but now it’s just annoying. I’d rather switch to another platform than pay €5 a month just to skip songs. Until they improve, I won’t be using Spotify anymore.

Less than a week ago i signed up and used a free account, logged in this morning and one of my playlists had been deleted, 30 odd tunes I meticulously searched for and put in place gone, no reason given, and no chance of getting any explanation as to why! Fully intended upgrading to a payed account, but not now, I've learned a valuable lesson. Two stars given for the apps decent 'available' music content, three deleted to keep my playlist company. Account deleted, I won't be back!

Sure it plays music. But you can't skip songs more than 6 times an hour. You can't have a playlist and choose a song in it to listen to at a specific moment. All of this unless you buy the premium version. It's irritating the way that you need to add songs to your album. Basically if you have wifi, install an add-blocker and use YouTube instead of spotify. This app is only usefull to listen to music using mobile data since YouTube uses more data. Edit: Finding songs sucks the way they've done it

Spotify has been becoming more and more unusable with every update for the past decade or so. The recommendation algorithm used to be decent, but now it just pushes AI slop. Premiums used to be a way to at least send a few cents to my favourite artists out of each monthly payment, but now that money goes to major labels instead. Will ditch at the earliest opportunity.

2 stars for the recent update, not the app itself. Why did you remove the function to remove selected songs from the queue? If I shuffle a playlist (song radio, or just my liked songs), and I see a song I want to skip coming up, I used to be able to select that song and remove it from the queue. Now I can't, I can just "clear the queue" from any songs I manually added to it. What's the point in this update? You took away a useful feature.

Positive things:- 1 Firsts things first, it has most of the songs and we can listen to them without getting premium. Negetive things:- 1) it has way too many adds 2) it forces you to get premium 3) most of the songs do not have lyrics 4) we can't control which songs to plays in a playlist and it is always shuffle and you need to get premium to get the option to get to not shuffle it.

There is some sort of bug that keeps stopping what I'm playing at random times, and when I go to play it again, it does it over and over again. At first it started on my Blutooth Devices, and now it's happening when I even try to listen on my phone. I Love the Spotify app, but over the last few weeks, it has NOT been enjoyable at all! Please Fix!

Generally its a great app and is working great. Somtimes it needs longer to load but nothing major. However, the last Update completly took away all function of the queue. Now you cannot delete tracks from the queue anymore, put them from the queue into the regular playlist or and them to the queue again. Please revert these changes and the app will be way better again.

It used to work fine. I'm not sure what happened but if they don't fix this soon then I'm gone. They keep upping subscription prices and can't even be bothered to fix it. I try to tap on songs to play and way too many of them just won't play, even songs I've downloaded, even local imports. It'll just stop. I've tried closing the app and opening again. I've tried uninstalling then reinstalling. There's fundamentally something wrong with the app since other people here are having the same problem

I'm appalled, disappointed, and frustrated with this music app. The developers prioritize greed over user experience, bombarding you with prompts to upgrade to premium the moment you open the app. Want to play a song of your choice? Premium. Want to create a playlist? Premium. Want to listen to a single song without ads? Premium. This aggressive approach is insulting, implying that the developers don't care about your music preferences or experience. Hate this app!

Awesome for listening to music! Can be a bit glitchy and slow at times but easy to use once you get the hang of it!! I love using it to assemble playlists which I can share with my besties, although it's not so good for wanting to listen to specific songs in a certain order because you have to pay to be able to do that.

There are tools to migrate your playlist away if you're worried about the effort you put into tying yourself to Spotify. Spotify is a perfect example of an app that is enshittification in action. Everything from removing song length information to making albums harder to find. It's made to get us to listen to whatever they want to push hardest, and the cracks are showing now. The Spotify wrapped was exemplary AI slop, and the "courses" are just exploitative scams by crypto/ai bros.

Good app, decent audio quality, plenty of musics and artists. Sometimes the music I'm currently listening somehow is removed from my personal playlist for no reason at all. It's worse when I can't remember the name to search and add it again. Waiting for this bug be fixed, until then 4 stars.

This was the best music app ever "WAS". The new app updates just removed the basic features of the music app, almost everything requires premium now. I've been using it for more than 4 years, These new updates didn't make anything easier or better, everything seems to be useless at this point. Listening to music was perfect before, now it's just annoying coz there's literally no way of listening to songs the way we want to, deleting is the only solution if this doesn't change.

can't believe I pay for this... videos won't play when I'm a passenger In a car and the algorithm that suggests music has completely stopped working lately doesn't suggest music in my tastes anymore. worst music app I could imagine and it's the only choice. very good opportunity for a new company to open I wish I could give my business to a different app It's been years this review remains unchanged. None of these issues have been fixed. Spotify; "oh our app has issues? piss off, we don't care"

Slow slow slow. Used to be so seemless and responsive. Now it is ridiculously slow in every aspect; starting up, loading, searching, playing, pausing. I even force closed the app and it still continued to play for >30 seconds. Tried all the usual things to resolve (logging out and in, restarting phone, redownloading, etc) all to no avail. Not a WiFi issue as other apps work fine and can use Spotify on Ipad with no issues.

Getting super frustrated when coming to downloading podcasts. If you get into podcasts later on in its run, when there is plenty of backlog episodes to listen to, there is no option to download the whole lot *Update* Still super annoying to download a podcast's back catalogue or to redownload episodes after you've listened to them but it's pretty convenient to have all my music and podcasts in one place. My other complaint was just a user error so 🤷

I hate how the (+) button now adds the recommended songs to 'Liked Songs' instead of the last playlist I was listening to. Before, it automatically added them to the active playlist, but now I have to manually change it every time. This is frustrating, especially since my playlists are genre-based and the recommendations match them. I mostly listen when driving, so now I have to take my eyes off the road to do this. Please add an option in the settings to restore the previous behavior.

The app was working perfectly fine until a month ago or so, then it was completely broken. It is slow now, uses a ton of battery and, worst of all, it still uses up massive amounts of mobile data, even though I downloaded my podcasts on WiFi. This is unacceptable! Please test your new software versions before rolling them in. And also hire competent developers.

I really dislike "made for you", and "picked for you". I only use Spotify for music. I have NO interest in podcasts, audiobooks, videos, etc. I just want MUSIC 🥺 Seriously hate the way Spotify is going. I just want a clean streaming music app. Please implement a way of disabling features, or to not show them, in the settings. Yes, I know I can "dislike", etc, but it doesn't go away. Just bloat after bloat, after bloat. I am thinking of dropping Spotify, as it's getting more and more bloated.

I LOVED Spotify, been using it for years because it's only the music app suitable for me. But the updates has been making me upset recently because of the limited skips. And now I can't even choose the songs I want to play?? I was confused when I was searching up a specific song and it wouldn't let me play it. Apparently, I've used all the freeplay or whatever up. I get ads almost every two songs and it kills the mood. I haven't gotten a verified money app so I can't buy premium either 💔

Stop adding useless stuff and if you do add some "new" feature create a toggle to disable or enable it. For example: The useless and annoying "Picked for you" section is bugged, no matter how many time i dislike it it won't go away. It also ruins the aesthetic of the Homepage. I get it that you fire a lot of people recently but that is why you need to a toggle for any new feature especially if it's bugged.

Completely unnecessary to update the queue screen, looks no better and you've made it much less useful - i can no longer remove songs from the queue AT ALL, and to add a song to play next i have to search that specific song. It is so much harder now to use smoothly. Genuinely going to consider going to a different app if it isn't reverted

(Premium user)Kind of getting annoyed at the amount of bugs on this app, it never used to be like this a few years ago. Firstly the shuffle feature doesn't actually shuffle anymore and just plays the same songs I have thousands of songs on my liked playlist and probably only hear 50. Every time I press shuffle it plays the exact same song and then plays about 10 of the same songs in the same order every time. Spotify sort it out.

God I wish Spotify changes. I've been running into problems after problems with this goddamn app! First you put shuffle behind a pay wall, then you give out limited skips, increase the ads between songs, and now I can't even access some of my songs?! No matter how many times I click on those songs, they REFUSE to play. What the hell happened, Spotify?? I do not recommend this to ANYONE.

The latest update has changed the queue functionality. Whereas before you could select multiple songs from the queue that you wanted to remove, you now have to swipe each song individually. However the swipe function is terrible and takes about 15 tries to get rid of the song!! I honestly don't understand why they have changed it. Is there a way to revert back to how it used to be?

Keep having an issue where it'll happily play the ads but then at the end of the ads it'll just refuse to continue playing songs. Causing me to need to close the app and play again and sometimes that doesn't even fix it and the play list will say it's playing but just not do that or even show at the bottom godknows why it's happening but it's not great. Edit: tried uninstalling and reinstalling and whilst it's lessened my original issues new ones have arose so yeah it's kinda janky atm

Brilliant application, also you save when you add more people to the plans . The world of music at your fingertips , one thing that could be improved is the search engine you have to be a bit too specific when searching for a song you can't remember . When this happens to me I search the song on YouTube then enter the correct name in search 9/10

I have had Spotify since 2019 and the last few months it's been basically impossible to use, so glitchy and frustrating, I can't change my profile picture because it always says something went wrong, I can't shuffle my liked songs, it will take at least 30 seconds to load the first song and then to skip is a whole other battle, absolute garbage. Update: it's gotten to a point it doesn't even load my liked songs anymore, I am seriously considering going to YouTube music instead.

Love Spotify, its ease of use, making playlists, creating a jam, etc. App has great features, but for God's sake please let me shuffle my playlists. When hitting shuffle, the same 20-30 songs will play every single time, while the 800+ other songs in said playlists will only play once every few months. I listen to over 200K minutes of music per year, which places me in the top 0.1% of Spotify users worldwide and have this problem EVERY. SINGLE. DAY.

It's clear when an artist is paying Spotify to get their music recommended to you to an insulting degree and you have no way to block it or remove it from the homepage even as a paying user. Creating a playlist is a bit finicky, search is terrible unless you know exactly the name of the artist and the song, you can't add multiple songs from an album unless you do it one by one. It's awful. You have no control basically even if you pay.

I used to love Spotify, but the free version is now a disaster. Ads are constant and disruptive, interrupting my listening experience every 3-4 songs. The shuffle feature is a complete joke, playing the same songs over and over again. It's frustrating and makes the free version almost unusable. I'm seriously considering switching to a paid service or another platform altogether

Very poor user experience overall. I listen to podcasts while driving and to say that the experience is subpar would be too kind. There's no way to filter based on the podcast, time, genre of music while driving. From the end user perspective it looks like android auto is only added as a tickbox exercise and there's been little or no effort to develop a consistent experience with the mobile app. I could write a book on how poor the experience is, if spotify wants detailed feedback msg me.

Overall very satisfied, with the one exception being that the app randomly deleted 75% of my liked songs for no apparent reason. I had many moons worth of favorites that I liked to peruse, and now I wander glossy-eyed through a dense forest of music that quickly passes me by like the gone-too-soon summer days of my childhood. Would still recommend this app with a premium account though...

What is this Liked Songs folder doing in my playlists? Now, when I'm browsing through saved albums, every single track is ticked and entered in the Liked Songs playlist, so I can't pick out the tracks that I have saved in Playlists I've created. Why won't these tech companies leave users to have control over their choices? I'm paying for this after all. What a load of bollox!

I'm just sick of the inconsistency of this app. You can't play songs sequentially from searched results, sometimes you just want to listen to a specific artist from liked songs without creating a list. 2, you can't enable a song to immediately play next, except being to added to an existing queue and it sits at the bottom of the queue, you don't have to drag a song for God's sake. The app generally takes a great deal of time to load. It doesn't have Go to Song button. Just empty

I have been trying to change my subscription to a 2 person subscription so that my wife can hear music at the same time and its imposible to do so. like using the free app. let's of great music to look through and make Playlists from. not the biggest fan of only 6 skips per day. I know the free usage has draw backs but it was better with unlimited skips just more ad time between songs also having other songs being interjected in a Playlist that doesn't have any of the genre isn't always welcomed either

I am about done with this app, I dislike the fact that you only shuffle on free mode, but for the love of Christ, when I click into an album or play list id like to hear songs in that album and playlist before you go off into autoplay, and it shouldn't cost skips to get off a song that you didn't add to your playlist and plan to listen to, and please fix autoplay, it never plays music from artists I actually listen to or even close to the timeline I listen to, it just zones out into random stuff

Takes years to just load. I have to wait like crazy for it to just open Edit : uninstalled and reinstalled, now takes only 5 seconds to load. Will let you know if the issue comes up again or not. All time price go up only get few feature Shuffle plays the same songs over and over again DJ plays the same songs over and over again Smart shuffle plays the same songs over and over again just paired with every song you have removed from your playlist in the past 2 years. App keeps crashing when scrolling through my library, consistently. Edit: deleting cache and app data fixed this, purely because I realized the problem was a playlist containing songs from local files, which inexplicably cause spotify to crash when being played or even just by being on screen even when I deleted the files manually outside the app. It also caused me to have to redownload all my music from scratch to be able to play it offline, so it stays one star.

It's a nice music player app, I use it 24/7. My favorite feature is definitely Spotify Wrapped, it's really fun! However, there were SOOO MANY ADS and you didn't have the option to play a song on repeat. I had to get premium, which solves that problem. Overall, it's alright.

All features very navigable, but the change to song queuing is a huge backwards step. It was hard enough to select songs without clicking on one, but now it's tedious as hell and inconvenient to try and curate a set of songs while having to remove or add them one by one. Functionality is much more useful than visuals, hope this change is rolled back soon.

this app doesn't seem bad, but in reality its garbage. the ux sucks, the ui is inconsistent among menus. the basic feature of LISTENING TO SONGS YOU WANT TO is blocked behind a paywall. i click to play a song and it plays a completely different one. eventually im gonna switch to YouTube music. i heard about spotify all around the internet, decided to try it, and i was heavily disappointed. uninstalling this in a week after posting this review. just use YouTube music.

Most things about this app are fine (note I don't have premium). However, every second time I use Spotify I receive an announcement that the next 30 minutes are add free thanks to sponsor "insert name". One song later I get 2 adds. Nothing more frustrating than setting an expectation and failing to meet it over and over again

A horrible nightmare of an app to navigate through. Trying to actually look out and pick out a specific song to add to your playlist is just so inconvenient, confusing, unintuitive and badly designed. You look for a song but only get an album. The new UI and presentation of the queue is abysmal and hideous and incredibly inconvenient. The recent update made is many times worse than the previous presentation. App design bloody sucks and is very inconvenient

Auto playing videos of sports betting podcasts on the home feed is incredibly disappointing, with no way to hide them. I miss the old Spotify experience.

I’ve been using Spotify for over three years, and I absolutely love it! I use Premium, and it’s super affordable for what you get—no ads, unlimited skips, and offline listening. The app is so easy to use, and the playlists always fit my vibe. Whether I’m discovering new songs, jamming to old favorites, or checking out podcasts, it never disappoints. Spotify makes music feel personal and fun, and honestly, I can’t imagine life without it. Highly recommend it to everyone!

Been using Spotify for years, and I absolutely love it. My main problem is that as a casual listener, I don't want to pay to be ad free when I only listen for short time periods. Asked me to recommend to others and rate 5 stars. Plays me ads I'm not interested in, after I've said I'm not interested. Stops working after one song, then makes you play an ad to play another song before stopping again. The app is worse.

Atleast add something like playing history so that we can check what were we listening to in case we forget, or maybe we wanna play something else while in the middle of an album. Introduce some kind of feature to resume playing from the song left. The recent update sucks too much . Very good app and content. I have found so many music bands and artists from past. I thought I will never hear they music again but magic happens and I have found Spotify. Trash. Absolutely trash. This used to be a good music app, I mean what do you mean we cant skip songs? And we even can't choose what we wanna hear either now. Its bad, Every time i make a new playlist, I get songs i dont want added on my playlist, and everytime i get one of thoes "30 mimeuts no ads " ads. Love the app but wish Spotify had a lower tiered paid subscription that is just for plain old music streaming with offline listening and making playlists. Absolutely trash. Absolute money grabbing app now. They used to give us atleast some free features, but no, "buy premium". Don't know why I'm even writing here, because the reviews team is just gonna copy and paste the same answer they do for every review, but: I’m really frustrated with the change to the search function in my liked songs. Everything needs premium now. You can't choose songs much, switch to a certain part in the play bar, or skip songs unless you have premium. Lyrics mostly aren't even there. Even shuffling isn't good. As a Spotify user in Germany, I enjoy the platform but miss a feature to choose my preferred language for recommendations. I pay for the app but still gets ads in various spammy formats, many of which cannot be disabled. Even if you disable them all they'll add a new one in a months time! Disgusting. Too many ads and can't justify 15/mth to be rid of them 🤷 maybe 5/mth would suit better. I have the premium plan, but there is no option for audiobooks. I have deleted the app, reinstalled it, and cleaned my cache. I googled exactly how to "find my audiobooks". I don't know what has happened to the Spotify app. I feel like I'm just using it because I've already subscribed. Any action you do, it will take some time to load. ★★★★☆ Great Music Streaming with Some Room for Improvement Spotify is an excellent music streaming service with a vast library, personalized playlists, and a user-friendly interface. The ability to discover new music through features like "Discover Weekly" and "Release Radar" is a big plus. The sound quality is solid, and the seamless integration across devices makes it easy to listen anywhere. However, there are a few areas for improvement. The free version has frequent ads, which can be disr

I use Spotify daily, and I absolutely love its beautiful UI and excellent audio quality. As a pop music fan, it delivers exactly what I need. Unlike YouTube Music, Spotify’s free version allows background playback, making it an indispensable part of my routine. I haven’t encountered any issues, and I highly recommend it to everyone!

This platform offers a diverse range of musical experiences for everyone. The vast library is easily accessible and provides endless entertainment. Enjoy seamless streaming and immerse yourself in the world of music.
